programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A group of teenagers threatens a bus driver, so Reg Hollis steps in to help _ but when one of the kids whips out a gun and another gets behind the wheel, the PC becomes Sun Hill's answer to Keanu Reeves as the vehicle speeds away. Polly Page is disappointed to hear her doctor friend Owen Preston is suspected of a violent assault, and even more shocked when he asks a massive favour of her

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Polly Page is racked with guilt over Owen Preston's suicide, but with a little persuasion from Cathy Bradford decides to cover up her involvement, while Sheelagh Murphy worries that Des Taviner may have been shot in an armed robbery. Journalist Dougie Pritchard, who learnt the identity of Abi Nixon's father from deceased sergeant Matt Boyden, turns up wanting to speak to the girl's mother

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: It's a testing time for Samantha Nixon - journalist Dougie Pritchard knows that Abi's father killed a child when he was just a youngster himself, and now seems hell-bent on telling the DI's daughter all about her parentage. But the situation takes another twist when Sam suddenly spots her ex-lover outside the station - and he's found out he has a daughter

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Todd Carty joins the cast as PC Gabriel Kent - who soon makes a big impression on Tony Stamp, proving he's not going to be a pushover. Glen Weston's sudden reappearance throws Samantha and Abi Nixon's lives into turmoil, but Abi is keen to get to know her father at last. Elsewhere, Phil Hunter thinks more double-dealing is afoot

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ken Drummond goes undercover in an attempt to identify the dodgy security guard who's been setting up the recent robberies, but it's not long before his penchant for gambling gets him in way over his head with his prime suspects - the Fosters. Samantha Nixon grows increasingly concerned about daughter Abi's well-being as the youngster grasps every opportunity to get to know her dad

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: As spring arrives, Nonnatus House welcomes two new nuns, the experienced Sister Hilda and newly qualified Sister Frances, who must acclimatise to the changing East End. A complicated multiple birth tests the skills of some of the midwives to the limit, but Trixie has to face her fears and Valerie deals with a shocking case that arrives unexpectedly

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Period drama re-imagining the works of Charles Dickens as inter-connected tales, set in a fictional version of 19th-century London. The likes of Oliver Twist's Fagin and the Artful Dodger live alongside and interact with the wealthy Barbarys of Bleak House, and the homely Cratchitts of A Christmas Carol, in events that eventually set up the stories featured in their respective novels. The saga begins on Christmas Eve, as Amelia and Arthur Havisham gather to hear the reading of their father's will, and the ruthless nature of debt collector Jacob Marley appears to give someone a motive for murder. Starring Stephen Rea, Pauline Collins, Caroline Quentin, Tom Weston-Jones, Tuppence Middleton, Anton Lesser and Omid Djalili

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Christmas Day arrives and news of Jacob Marley's murder dampens the festivities, giving Inspector Bucket a new investigation to pursue. Meanwhile, at Satis House, Amelia Havisham's mysterious rescuer makes another appearance. Period drama, weaving together the back-stories of some of Dickens' various tales, starring Stephen Rea, Tuppence Middleton and Ben Starr

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's A Dinner of Herbs
programme.desc: First in a two-part drama, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. The youngster soon makes friends with a local girl and the future looks rosy - but heartbreak is waiting just around the corner. With Tim Healy, Jonathan Kerrigan and Michael Jayston

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface and her father play a dangerous game when they investigate suspicions of espionage at a chess tournament

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: When leading fashion designer Marco Bergman commits suicide, his son Claude sets out to shatter the cosy world view of feature writer Donna Henry, who savaged him in print, by appearing to change identity before her eyes. The unconventional sleuth attempts to find a rational explanation for this apparent miracle and is drawn into an even more puzzling mystery involving a drawer full of socks and a parrot called Harvey. Offbeat detective drama, guest starring Maureen Lipman and Bill Bailey

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Professional sceptic Justin Mallory, who dedicated his life to debunking fraudulent paranormal phenomena, dies in a tragic boating accident. But when his body mysteriously disappears and his lover Geraldine claims his spirit has been trying to contact her, it seems only Jonathan Creek and sidekick Carla Borrego are able to lay his ghost to rest. Offbeat mystery, starring Alan Davies and Julia Sawalha.

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part one of two. A dangerous patient and former Whitechapel resident escapes from a psychiatric unit around the same time a babysitter is murdered. With the area becoming the focus of a series of terrifying events in quick succession, Chandler's quest to bring in a suspect alive jeopardises his relationship with Miles. Two-part series finale, starring Rupert Penry-Jones and Phil Davis

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part two of two. With the body count rising, Miles and Chandler clash over the direction of the investigation, and struggle to put aside their differences in the face of their toughest adversary to date. Counsellor Morgan Lamb is of particular interest to the team, having already survived the killer's wrath, and Chandler has a vested interest in keeping her alive. Starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Lydia Leonard

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: The detective is a broken man after being accused of crimes he hasn't committed and is forced to work outside the law in an attempt to catch vigilante killer Marwood, who has made his vendetta personal by targeting Luther and those closest to him. As Stark hurries Mary into hiding for her own protection - hoping to lure the detective into a trap - the man himself continues his private investigation, realising that the killer won't be satisfied until he has punished the man responsible for his wife's death - and when he kidnaps an innocent woman, the stage is set for a dramatic showdown in which Luther is forced to make an impossible decision. Idris Elba stars as the maverick cop, with Sienna Guillory, Elliot Cowan and David O'Hara

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: As the repercussions of Christina's actions start to hit home, Father Michael makes a discovery and must act fast to help her justify what happened to the authorities and her sister, Mariella. Meanwhile, new parishioner Roz attends confession to share a huge secret, prompting the priest to share a dark confession of his own in an attempt to dissuade her from the desperate course of action she has planned. The two share a connection, but is it wise for Father Michael to confide his own secrets to someone struggling to deal with their own?

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Valerie helps mother of five Betty come to terms with her sixth child's birth defect. The Turners oversee a measles vaccination trial at the clinic, but are concerned by an overly anxious first-time mother. They soon discover she is concealing a devastating loss, which could have serious repercussions. Nurse Crane decides to bring a taste of the seaside to Poplar for the Whitsun bank holiday, and Violet's political career goes from strength to strength as she wins the seat on the council for Poplar North

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe has his hands full again, with Fisher breathing down his neck over an operation to seize stolen vehicles, and a fussy food inspector causing a stir at the restaurant. Crime drama, guest starring Phyllis Logan, with Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Lady Jane persuades Lovejoy to act as driver for an old friend who has to attend her sea-faring brother's burial. The roguish antiques dealer is given the job of selling the late captain's Second World War medals, and there is a smart fashion photographer who wants them. However, some drunken sailors then come into the picture and Lovejoy finds himself dealing with the gun-toting Italian Angelo Pantaloni. Light-hearted drama, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Two members of staff find themselves in a tight spot, as Louis is bleeding out after being attacked by an old friend, while Cameron still has Ange held hostage - although the truth of his crimes is coming to light. Can he lie his way out of Holby or will those he has tricked manage to save their colleague end his reign of terror? Meanwhile, Dom returns to work after his operation and his decision to sue the hospital - and despite his attempts to forget the past, a petty patient soon revives his hunger for revenge

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The staff of Holby General must deal with a case of suspected child abuse. Duffy and her boyfriend have a disagreement about their holiday. Sarring Cathy Shipton

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A police warehouse used to store millions of pounds' worth of luxury sports cars is targeted by arch-villains the Fosters, who have enlisted undercover cop Ken Drummond to be their reluctant inside man. However, when the unfortunate DC's failure to report in is noted at Sun Hill, Debbie McAllister and Juliet Becker are dispatched to find out what's going on

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Spencer makes Vicki an offer. Vicki realises she's going to have to make her own decisions. Sonia confides in Phil

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Lynne's worried about her marriage. Kat's true feelings for Alfie are finally revealed

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth
programme.desc: Hamish's anguish over Alex's death drives him to a deserted island, where he pulls out a revolver, intending to end his life. Meanwhile, back in Lochdubh, his overzealous temporary replacement finds that everyone in the village is breaking the law. Rural drama, starring Robert Carlyle

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer is arrested on suspicion of armed robbery - and to make matters worse, the only way he can clear his name is by admitting he was with a charming ex-girlfriend at the time. He must decide whether to come clean and face a jealous Charlotte's wrath, or take the consequences of the charge. Ian McShane stars

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Joanna has to break devastating news to a teenage gymnast, and finds herself thrust into the middle of a family crisis. Drama, starring Haydn Gwynne and Gary Mavers

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Tom becomes depressed after suffering a mild heart attack, so the management enlists Diana's help to try to cheer him up. Graham Crowden and Stephanie Cole star

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: What started as a joke takes on a life of its own when Clegg tells Howard that he was adopted and that his real parents are dead. Alvin is very insistent that he will get a kite to fly - and finds several ways to try to get it done. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Brian Murphy

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly spots a bottle with a message inside floating down the river, and decides to catch it - so enlists the help of Clegg, Billy and Alvin to follow its elusive course and eventually read the mysterious contents. Long-running comedy, starring Frank Thornton, Peter Sallis, Keith Clifford and Brian Murphy

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Dangerous investigates the arson murder of an artist and former lottery winner burned to death while drunk in a locked room. An often abusive alcoholic, Maurice Lehman had lived with his attractive Irish wife, 20 years his junior, and a teenage Granadan boy whom he had adopted. Drama, guest starring Anita Dobson and Karl Howman, with Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra Pullman and the team re-open the 17-year-old case of a murdered policewoman when it is revealed that a gun discovered in a diving operation was used to kill her. The team suspects a stalker, seen in the area at the time, is responsible for the killing, but when DNA evidence reveals that the same gun was also used in an armed robbery six months previously, a web of lies involving a faked robbery and a gang of money-laundering thieves is exposed. Amanda Redman stars

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team members have to draw on their powers of detection and discretion when a painting in the Queen's private collection is found to be a fake - and all the clues lead to an art forger and political activist who seemingly committed suicide after a fire destroyed his studio. Meanwhile, prospective grandfather Standing has to sell his beloved Triumph Stag to buy his pregnant daughter a pushchair. Anthony Head guest stars alongside Dennis Waterman and Amanda Redman

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Harry's burgeoning relationship with Nikki is jeopardised when his former girlfriend Penny is killed in a car crash. It looks like suicide at first glance, but DCI Ambrose uncovers evidence that the victim may have had an affair - as well as a secret child. Meanwhile, Leo examines the staged death of a conceptual artist

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne is drawn into a conflict between an estranged mother and daughter, both of whom are pregnant. Nurse Crane visits a photographic gallery in Soho with Sgt Woolf, but the trip does not go to plan, and Sister Frances' shyness causes concern. Trixie's keep fit class is chosen to host a special event, but her star pupil is devastated to learn that she is pregnant

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Two members of staff find themselves in a tight spot, as Louis is bleeding out after being attacked by an old friend, while Cameron still has Ange held hostage - although the truth of his crimes is coming to light. programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A collector from Australia visits Britain to search for the one item he's coveted all his life - the legendary Benin Bronze. Unfortunately, the DTI won't allow an export licence, so he devises another way of getting hold of it. Drama, starring Ian McShane

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: In the aftermath of Cameron's comeuppance, Nicky vents her frustrations on a patient - and is forced to ask herself whether she really wants to raise a killer's baby. Reyhan challenges a traumatised Hanssen to tell Sahira the truth, but can he do it knowing it will destroy her? The AAU staff are surprised to see Ange back in scrubs so soon after her ordeal

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Peter reveals his HIV status to Duffy, but her reaction is not what he expects. Meanwhile, Ted has a proposal for Megan. Drama, starring Derek Thompson and Cathy Shipton

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the bungled robbery, Ken is rushed to hospital, but when word gets out that the crooks are planning to target his son Alex in revenge, the wounded DC faces a race against time to save the youngster. Meanwhile, his colleagues try to fathom who would have the bottle to cheat the Fosters out of their booty _ and how so many luxury cars could simply disappear

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat gets sloshed and declares her love for Alfie. Kat is forced to confront her feelings for Alfie, Sharon has news for Vicki, and Derek has a plan for Martin

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Alfie is shocked by Kat's revelation and while she drinks champagne, he completes an assault course around Walford

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth
programme.desc: Hamish is called after aliens are blamed for the disappearance of a body from the village burial ground, and Lachie Jr starts his new job as an undertaker. Comedy drama, starring Robert Carlyle

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A penniless sculptor seeks the canny dealer's help to prise a considerable inheritance out of his avaricious brother. Celia Imrie guest stars, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The sickly folk of Cardale are hit by yet another mystery illness, which sweeps through the village spreading terror in its wake _ and poor old Andrew, whose only desire is to get away from it all, finds himself drawn into deadly danger. Gary Mavers stars in the medical drama

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: The managers of Bayview Retirement Village threaten to expel Diana, prompting Tom to come up with a blackmail plot. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The arrival of Clegg's cousin threatens to spell the end of the gang's gentle walks, so they resolve to get rid of him. Aubrey finds he can still beat Billy and Alvin cycling up hills, but discovers his own weakness. Starring Peter Sallis

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly's plans to rescue Howard from his bedroom are given a boost when Auntie Wainwright puts some lightweight scaffolding up for sale - ideal for springing someone imprisoned on an upper floor. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton and Robert Fyfe

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The coppers search for the killer of docusoap star Efrona Davis, whose body has been found washed ashore. It soon emerges that she received a knock to the head before entering the water, and the list of suspects includes her father, Wayland Bay's resident comedian Rowan Priestley and Gavin Oldham, a man she arranged a date with on the night she died. The investigation takes a surprising turn when a second body is found on the beach. Ricky Tomlinson and John McArdle guest star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team is given the task of re-examining the unsolved case of peace protester Josh Livesey, found dead near a nuclear base in 1984. Other campaigners pleaded innocence at the time, but refused to co-operate with police, blaming the death on Secret Service skulduggery. Detective drama, starring Alun Armstrong, James Bolam, Amanda Redman and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Leo confronts the painful memories of his daughter's death when he investigates the apparent suicide of 14-year-old Alison Garland, and with the help of a child psychologist he realises the girl was murdered. The case is also linked to another incident in which a car salesman was killed with the same knife. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, starring William Gaminara

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner opens a new screening clinic for cervical cancer, and one of the first patients is a woman who is about to be married and has never had a period. Trixie supports her as she discovers she has a rare condition, but the diagnosis could have far more devastating repercussions than either of them could have imagine. Sister Frances confronts her fear of public speaking, Lucille has a new romance in her life, and a father-to-be experiences strange pains similar to his wife's pregnancy symptoms

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: In the aftermath of Cameron's comeuppance, Nicky vents her frustrations on a patient - and is forced to ask herself whether she really wants to raise a killer's baby. The feat put him in good company, with former world number ones Lleyton Hewitt, Andy Roddick and Andy Murray the other players to have won this title two or more times in a row this century

programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich transform a garden in Bournemouth for young married couple Thomas and Rhiann. They have a budget of £3,000 to create a shady, flower-filled space in their sunny back garden and Tom has a lifelong dream of putting in a massive koi carp pond

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne presents two more of today's performances from the Pyramid Stage. Rick Astley makes his Glastonbury debut with a mass singalong of 1980s hits, while New York punk pop legends Blondie will be taking to the stage with classic numbers from their five decade long career

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Rare Breed Survival Trust, a charity founded by his father to reverse the decline of rare breed numbers in the UK. With summer temperatures rising, Adam welcomes a shearing gang on site to remove the coats of his commercial sheep, and is visited by the Chief Executive of the British Pig Association. Plus, a Gloucester Bull is prepared for a day at a country show

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: The final episode explores the challenges that ocean life must overcome, including baby elephant seals and humpback whales endangered as their mothers end up surrounded by males vying for supremacy. A lone sealion chases tuna, one of the fastest fish in the ocean. Not only must it find a way of catching this enormous fish, but it must do so whilst fighting off hungry sharks

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce hosts from Woodhorn Museum in Northumberland. Treasures brought in to be valued include a gold Rolex 'President' wristwatch from the 1980s and a grotesque ceramic animal sculpture made by the eccentric Martin Brothers. Suzanne Zack is enchanted by a beautifully rendered pencil portrait by British artist Henry Ryland, while John Foster falls for a small Roman figure uncovered by a metal detectorist. Plus, Fiona learns tells the story of coal mining and the miners' way of life in the north-east of England

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo, Lauren Laverne, Jack Saunders and Jo Whiley present the historic final performance of this year's festival, as Elton John makes his Glastonbury debut with a set that also marks the last show of his final UK tour. With a career of hits spanning over five decades, it's guaranteed to be a spectacular and emotional swan song to one of the world's greatest showmen

programme.title: Tulip Fever (2017)
programme.desc: In 17th-century Amsterdam at the height of tulip mania, an artist falls in love with a married woman whose portrait he has been commissioned to paint. Historical romance based on Deborah Moggach's novel, starring Alicia Vikander, Dane DeHaan and Jack O'Connell

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gordon Smart and Michelle Ackerley host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Stadium medics battle to save the life of a football fan who suffers a cardiac arrest on the way to a match. Plus, a family home is destroyed by a car

programme.title: Countryfile Summer Diaries
programme.desc: John Craven explores Poldark country on the north Cornwall coast, and Keeley Donovan reports from the beach in Scarborough as she discovers how people need to be more sun savvy. Paul Martin is in Surrey with actor and animal rights champion Jenny Seagrove. Horse-mad since she was a youngster, Jenny has turned her passion into a mission to rescue abandoned ponies and horses

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Tommy Walsh follow the progress of properties in the process of changing hand. Tommy is by the seaside in the Norfolk village of Eccles on Sea to see a very unusual, wooden constructed property that he fears may be beyond salvation. He's also in Islington, north London, living the high life at a two-bed flat situated in one of the upper floors of a high-rise building. Dion is in Sheffield to view an intriguing auction lot comprising of three terraced houses

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Ardingly in West Sussex, and finds out about a wildlife collection put together by a Victorian naturalist. With experts Jonathan Pratt and Ochuko Ojiri

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble return to Longleat Safari Park, where hopes are rising that the first baby southern koala to be born in Europe will soon arrive. A lion's solitary behaviour puts her in danger from other members of the pride, and a pygmy goat has his first ever bath

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is at Witley recycling centre in Surrey, where she rescues a G-Plan unit, a bookcase and a papasan seat with the help of artist Zoe Murphy and restorer Peter Fournel

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman teams up with an author and writer from west London who wants to pen an exciting new chapter for herself in the Oxfordshire countryside. Away from the property hunt, Nicki visits a small village in the county to find out why it was dubbed 'the kindest village in Britain'

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Bettina and Baljinder want to transform their tired empty plot into a fun, quirky, sociable spot. Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill head to Tadley, Hampshire, to bring bright colour and 'wow factor' to the couple's garden, within a £4,000 budget

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Irita Marriott take a ride around Suffolk and Norfolk, purchasing bargains including a damaged Stoneware Doulton flask and a 19th-century automaton

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Lauren Laverne reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: George goes on a mission in search of answers about Rose and Billy is reeling as he makes the final preparations for Lola's funeral. Tensions rise between Vinny and Finlay and Kathy is not happy with Rocky's pet bird

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: From spy balloons to secret police stations to dissidents on the run, Panorama investigates China's global surveillance operation. The film reveals new details about Beijing's fleet of spy balloons and hacks a Chinese-made security camera to show how similar devices that line our streets could be exploited

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Rose Ayling-Ellis: Signs for Change
programme.desc: The actress presents a personal journey into the deaf experience, and asks how attitudes are changing in light of British Sign Language being officially recognised in law. The film follows her through performing Shakespeare's As You Like It, and reflects on her time as the first regular deaf character in EastEnders and deaf contestant and winner of Strictly Come Dancing. She also meets with a charity that teaches deaf children to speak, and Rose explores how technology plays a role in the lives of deaf people

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: When former child soldier Baba rescues Freddy from a sexual assault, something dark is ignited in them. The pair's lust for each other takes over and creates a truly deadly duo. DS Lola Franks and DI Jackson Mendy get thrown together to investigate the murder of the pair's first victim. Jackson's history of working in police anti-corruption infuriates Lola, so too does his firmly held belief that no one can ever be held entirely responsible for their actions. Crime drama, starring Babou Ceesay and Eve Myles

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The finalists must impress in the creative brief to get to the final industry assignment: a masterclass at Harvey Nichols in front of industry heavy weights. One MUA's design comes to them in a dream, another adds a light up effect to their look. One person calls upon Celtic mythology in their look while another brings an aquatic alien to life but at the end of it all one MUA's journey comes to an end at the final hurdle while the remaining three prepare to give a masterclass to an audience of make-up stars including Millie Kendall from the British Beauty Council, Marvel's film and TV make-up designer Lizzie Yianni-Georgiou, fashion brands like ASOS and an array of beauty journalists from all kinds of publications. Who will come out victorious and be named Britain's Next Make-up Star?

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: The 64th series concludes with a show dedicated to outgoing Prime Minister Boris Johnson. Jack Dee hosts, with journalist Janet Street-Porter and comedian Phil Wang joining regular team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop on the panel

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Vick Hope present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A young woman races against the tide as she lies injured in a rock pool after falling 40ft down a cliff on holiday. A girl and her grandfather come close to tragedy on a bike ride

programme.title: Countryfile Summer Diaries
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in the Lake District discovering how recycled nappies and other soft plastics could be the answer to fixing the growing number of potholes in the road network

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion, Tommy and Jacqui meet the new owners of a house in Hednesford, Staffordshire and two retail spaces in Norwich and Weymouth to hear about their development plans

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Leominster, Herefordshire, and visits an antique doll restorer. Experts Kate Bliss and Ochucko Ojiri help out today's teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers nervously await the arrival of a capybara, the largest rodent in the world, and the presenters continue the story of Europe's first southern koala joey, as the staff do everything they can to ensure its survival

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers visits Dunbar Recycling Centre, hoping to uncover three lucrative items amongst the skip-bound trash. He enlists the help of woodworker Bruce Faulseit to repurpose a pair of guitars, whilst blacksmith Kev Paxton has to come up with a creative redesign for a round metal table frame. Meanwhile, JJ sets himself the challenge of revitalising a broken bed

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a keen singer from south-east London find a new home in Cambridgeshire, within a budget of £360,000. Together they explore a range of interesting property possibilities, potential new communities and plenty of countryside

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull head to Neath to create a Cornish-inspired garden for Helen and John. Helen was born in Cornwall, but moved to Wales as a child. The couple are keen to bring a touch of Helen's home county to Port Talbot. Within a £5,000 budget, Charlie and Chris turn this troublesome clay-soiled garden into a Cornish coastal haven

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Irita Marriott travel around Northamptonshire, where items include an art deco trinket box, a 1905 kaleidoscope, a B&B sign and an early Japanese satsuma pot

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Billy is nowhere to be seen on the day of Lola's funeral. Elaine and the Knights prepare for the wake but Anna struggles to keep a secret from her sister. After the funeral, Jay decides to record a final video on Lola's social media to thank her followers for their support

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The school launches their new radio station and Danny uses it as a chance to try to make amends. Myles's actions catch up with him and he is alienated by his peers. Nicky butts heads with Kai while she battles with guilt and Preston is forced to face his demons

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Retired electrician Wayne Bradshaw is a car boot sale enthusiast. His craft-loving wife Sue emotionally reveals that her son Alex is too embarrassed to bring people home to the clutter. Stacey gathers up all their possessions, leading to Sue and Wayne struggling to let go of over 30 years' worth of stuff. Carpenter Rob breathes new life into the family's home by rejigging the kitchen layout and upcycling old but much-loved items. Iwan gives the home a supersized spring clean and organizer Dilly shows the best way to sort out wardrobes

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: Nate and Mobeen are just weeks from the end of their sentence, but Mobeen's work as one of the prison's 'listeners' gets him into trouble with a terrifying inmate from another wing, a man known simply as Megalodon. While contending with this problem, Mobeen receives a visit from Aqsa, who's getting frustrated with certain aspects of life at medical school. Comedy, starring Guz Khan and Tolu Ogunmefun

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: In the prison infirmary, Mobeen sets out to befriend a man known as Memory Stick and convince him to hand over vital information. He also encounters a doctor, Nida, and there's an instant spark between the two of them. While Mobeen's in the hospital, Nate and Officer Harper develop a 'bromance'. Comedy, starring Guz Khan and Tolu Ogunmefun

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Alberta is thrilled when a super-fan visits the mansion, while Thorfinn convinces Hetty to go on a walk that would hopefully spark a special memory

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Hetty accidentally possesses Jay's body just as he and Sam are about to show Woodstone Mansion to a renowned wedding planner

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: In the first half of a two-part special where the same teams do battle across two episodes, the guests are former Wales cross-code rugby star Scott Quinnell, ex-England goalkeeper Rachel Brown-Finnis, Great Britain sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and world champion swimmer Karen Pickering. With team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost shares the results of his wild meadow turf experiment. In North Yorkshire, Nick Bailey discovers the range of floral beauty of Cornus Kousa, the dog wood tree. And Toby Buckland visits a back garden near Milton Keynes with seven ponds

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In an episode celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Welsh Surfing Federation, John Craven meets Linda Sharp, the UK's first female European champion who helped shape e Welsh surfing culture in the 1970s. He also joins Swansea's Surfers Against Sewage at one of their monthly beach cleans. Margherita Taylor discovers the magical landscape of the Kenfig sand dune system, Joe Crowley explores how nature could be threatened by the UK's growing demand for water, and Adam Henson catches up with young farmers

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Wildflowers and houseplants are at the heart of this week's show. Carole Baxter visits the garden of a specialist in the sowing and cultivation of wildflowers. Kirsty Wilson upcycles a second-hand cabinet and turns it into a display case for houseplants, complete with specialist lighting

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: In a weather-focused special, Dougie Vipond heads out into the North Sea to visit Scotland's biggest offshore wind farm as it nears completion, while Anne Lundon explores how the installation's impact on marine mammals is being monitored. Chris Blanchett finds out how a favourite summer treat is produced using the power of the sun in the north-east of Scotland

programme.title: The Edible Garden
programme.desc: Alys Fowler demonstrates how easy it is to grow raspberries and blueberries, and plants juicy fruits from which she then prepares jams and tangy fruit leathers. She also tries her hand at hapazome, a Japanese printing technique used to transfer flower and leaf shapes on to fabric

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: The final sees the two remaining families tasked to create a three-course extravaganza fit for a most special of family celebrations, with canapes to start, two main courses and two puddings. As arbitrators Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks watch on, tension mounts between participants as they strive for perfection

programme.title: Clash of the Titans (1981)
programme.desc: A hero of ancient Greece vows to save a princess from being sacrificed to a ferocious sea monster. However, to defeat the creature he must first embark on a journey into the underworld and seize the head of the monstrous Medusa, whose gaze turns men to stone. Mythical adventure, starring Harry Hamlin, Laurence Olivier, Maggie Smith and Judi Bowker, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms narrates a look at the TV appearances made over the years by Oscar-winning actor Laurence Olivier, using rare material from the BBC archives to capture the highlights and milestones of his life and extraordinarily distinguished career

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: In Art Week, the sewers start by make a skirt inspired by the Modernist movement. In the transformation challenge, the contestants are given canvases painted by local art students and turn them into dresses, making use of the sculptural fabric and painted design. For the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers take inspiration from the 20th Century Surrealist movement to create fantastical outfits for a mind-bending catwalk

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Extraordinary relationships among the creatures of the ocean, from spider crabs watching each other's backs for predators while they shed their shells, to fish cleaning the skins and teeth of hammerhead sharks. Off the coast of Costa Rica, a team of spy cameras capture a megapod of spinner dolphins, numbering in their thousands, working together to drive the flying fish from below while tuna and frigate birds pursue them in the air

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: The actor heads to Sicily, where Michelin-starred chef Tony Lo Coco shows off his signature dish of spaghetti alla bottarga. Stanley also meets artisanal winemaker Arianna Occhipinti and tries the grapes grown in the region's unique soils, and dines with Princess Stefania di Raffadali in Palermo.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team heads to Sandon Hall in Staffordshire, where Christina Trevanion and Charles Hanson find some treasures, while Paul Martin hears about pioneering local woman

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo, Lauren Laverne and Jack Saunders present coverage of the final day of Glastonbury, including folk singer-songwriter Yusuf/Cat Stevens in the Legends slot. From the Other Stage, chart-topping pop singer Becky Hill makes her debut and there are a couple of live performances in the studio and an interview with members of Bristol Reggae Orchestra and the Windrush Choir, the opening act on the Pyramid Stage today

programme.title: Dunkirk (2017)
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Jen Brister plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing routines by fellow comedians Esther Manito and Adam Rowe

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: As the festival comes to a close, Clara Amfo, Jack Saunders and Jo Whiley take a look back on a weekend of live music. They introduce highlights of the Sunday night headliners away from the Pyramid Stage, including French synthpoppers Phoenix on the Woodsies Stage, and London trio Rudimental at West Holts. There is one last unique intimate performance and the best moments from across the weekend

programme.title: LGBTQ+ Hits at the BBC
programme.desc: Performances by stars whose sex and sexuality is central to their careers and the songs they've created, including George Michael, Boy George, Freddie Mercury, Beth Ditto, MNEK, Lil Nas X and Barry Manilow. Some pushed boundaries and challenged gender stereotypes from the very start, while others only revealed their true selves after years of success and speculation, but all have played their part in changing the world of popular music

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Clacton-on-Sea, Essex, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Africa Rising with Afua Hirsch
programme.desc: Writer and broadcaster Afua Hirsch explores how young creatives are reinventing culture across Africa. She begins in Morocco, where she meets renowned photographer Hassan Hajjaj, who is updating traditional Moroccan style, goes riding with Tbourida horse rider Amal Amhari and explores Amazigh rug weaving with artist Sarah Allaoui. Afua also meets the country's new superstar singer Rym Fikri

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill come up with plans to transform an overgrown garden in Southampton into a tropical paradise perfect for friends and family to relax in

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to south London to help a mum-of-two with her overflowing kitchen and ever-growing shoe collection. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, the team adds clever storage to the kitchen and turns her spare room into a relaxing sanctuary with new shelving for her shoe display

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the annual Neath Food and Drink Festival and finds out whether traditional or gourmet Welsh cakes are more popular among the visitors. Food journalist Leyla Kazim reveals the secrets of growing tomatoes on a large or small scale farmer Jim Smith gets stuck into making marmalade and Ryan Hand tries an experiment to find out whether there is such a thing as brain food

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey across the vast and beautiful Morecambe Bay, where he joins one of the town's last shrimpers to find out how potted shrimp is made, From there, Michael makes his way to Arnside on the Furness Line, where he discovers a magnificently quirky 17th century garden, and across the Arnside viaduct, he reaches Cartmel and its 12th century priory and a Michelin-starred restaurant

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Tennis: Eastbourne
programme.desc: The Rothesay International Eastbourne Tennis Tournament. Gigi Salmon presents live coverage of day one of the women's grass court tournament from Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club, featuring first-round matches. The opening round was generally fruitful for the home players last year, with Jodie Burrage, Katie Boulter and Harriet Dart progressing against Petra Martic, Tereza Martincova and Madison Brengle respectively. However, Heather Watson could not make it four British players out of four in the second round, losing out to Rebecca Marino

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and Adam Partridge value items brought to Muncaster Castle, near Ravenglass in Cumbria, while Paul Martin finds out about the Lake District's bobbin industry. Items include a silver candlestick and some Coalbrookedale plates

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Maisie Adam, Ivo Graham, Dev Griffin and Zoe Lyons test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from London's Docklands to the Barbican, examining the story of the arrival at Tilbury in 1948 of the Empire Windrush, which brought more than a thousand passengers from the Caribbean to work in Britain. In Limehouse, Michael reflects on the Labour Party's landslide victory at the post-war general election of 1945 and hears what drove new prime minister Clement Attlee to strive for social change

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England Women v Australia Women. Action from the fifth and final day of the one-off Test from Trent Bridge, Nottingham, part of the multi-format Ashes Series. Whoever won this match will have received four points before the series moves on to three T20 internationals and three one-day internationals

programme.title: Your Body Uncovered with Kate Garraway
programme.desc: Kate speaks to two more patients with everyday medical conditions and together with Dr Guddi Singh, guides them on an interactive medical consultation, to help understand their illness. Rozi wants to understand why Covid-19 hit her so hard, while Adrian sees a consultant to find out why his prostate has enlarged so much that he is in agony

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: Three years ago, 35-year-old Ben went on a drink and drugs binge that ended with a failed bank robbery, having been released and reoffended numerous times before. His mum Denise desperately wants him to be given another chance, but is his drugs addiction so uncontrolled that the board will keep him locked up to protect the public? Thirty-year-old Jai has been in and out of prison since the age of fifteen and hopes that the board will think he has matured enough to put his criminal past behind him

programme.title: The Perfect Morecambe & Wise
programme.desc: Another selection of classic sketches and routines from the double act's shows. Eric organises a birthday party for Ernie, the duo put a whole new spin on making breakfast and they recreate the magic of Camelot with the help of Peter Cushing. Plus, Dusty Springfield performs How Can I Be Sure

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Last Right (2019)
programme.desc: A fateful exchange on a flight has consequences for Daniel Murphy, who is left in charge of a corpse of someone he never knew. He's persuaded to take on the challenge of getting a coffin from his family home in Clonakilty to Rathlin Island. Comedy drama, starring Michiel Huisman, Niamh Algar and Samuel Bottomley

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In an episode celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Welsh Surfing Federation, John Craven meets Linda Sharp, the UK's first female European champion who helped shape e Welsh surfing culture in the 1970s. He also joins Swansea's Surfers Against Sewage at one of their monthly beach cleans. Margherita Taylor discovers the magical landscape of the Kenfig sand dune system, Joe Crowley explores how nature could be threatened by the UK's growing demand for water, and Adam Henson catches up with young farmers

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Nicky considers the unthinkable as times get desperate. Preston and Myles challenging each other at the school fun run has devastating consequences for one, leaving the other facing questions from the other pupils

programme.title: Gods of Tennis
programme.desc: A look at how Czech-born Martina Navratilova began to dominate Wimbledon in the 1980s, but struggled to be as adored as her big US rival Chris Evert. At the heart of this story is Navratilova's search for acceptance, which culminated in an ambition to become the greatest player to ever grace Centre Court

programme.desc: The team head to Wilmslow to help Adam and Lauren transform their unsafe plot into a Chinese inspired family space with a woodland twist on a budget of £7,000

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: Cameras follow teams at three of the Trust's houses in Kent, including the former family home of Winston Churchill. Looking for a rural retreat within commutable distance of Westminster, in 1922 Winston and Clementine Churchill bought Chartwell House. The house was opened to the public in 1966, shortly after Churchill's death, and today it preserves a unique record of both his public and private lives

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Damian Johnson introduces action from the latest fixtures, including Catalans Dragons v Leigh Leopards, Hull FC v St Helens and Salford Red Devils v Wigan Warriors

programme.title: Tennis: Eastbourne
programme.desc: The Rothesay International Eastbourne Tennis Tournament. Gigi Salmon presents live coverage of day two of the women's grass court tournament from Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club, featuring second-round matches. British wild card Jodie Burrage delighted the home crowd at this stage last year with a shock 6-4, 6-3 victory over top seed Paula Badosa, and there was another minor upset when Elena Rybakina was beaten in three sets by Lesia Tsurenko. However Rybakina was able to recover from that setback and go on to win Wimbledon

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team heads to Norwich Cathedral, where Thomas Plant and Kate Bateman unearth items including a religious relic and a Martin Brothers vase, and Paul Martin visits the circus

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: On day two, former winners Maisie Adam, Ivo Graham, Dev Griffin and Zoe Lyons test their general knowledge skills, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits several of London's most famous locations, beginning on the South Bank, where the 1951 Festival of Britain drew more than eight and a half million visitors to admire fantastical buildings designed to inspire and celebrate the best of British in art, science and industry. After a spin on the London Eye, built to celebrate the millennium, Michael takes the London Underground to Chelsea to find out about Elizabeth David, one of the most influential cookery writers of the 20th century, and also heads to Covent Garden and Regent's Park

programme.title: NHS at 75 Live: Fit for the Future?
programme.desc: In a Newsnight special marking 75 years of the NHS, Kirsty Wark hosts a debate about the future of UK healthcare, live from Addenbrookes Hospital in Cambridge. Those taking part include TV doctor Xand van Tulleken and people working at the heart of the health service, to ask if the NHS is fit for the future

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: IT project manager Lee and actor Darren remodel their 1960s house in Southampton, after choosing a design using virtual reality. Architects Laura Jane Clark and Damion Burrows go head to head pitching their unique designs to the couple, with Laura Jane drawing inspiration from the property's original features and Damion planning to open up the house, giving it a better connection to the garden

programme.title: Africa Rising with Afua Hirsch
programme.desc: In South Africa, once a byword for racial segregation under the apartheid regime, Afua Hirsch finds a country in transition with a new creativity emerging from the roots up in the townships, as the once-oppressed reclaim their art scene. She explores how far this process is driven by what locals call 'ekasi', the street-cool of the townships, and has a dance lesson from viral amapiano dance star Bontle Modiselle. She also gets a new tattoo at Soweto Ink, goes bike spinning on Soweto's streets and meets hair sculptor Lebohang Motaung, whose gravity-defying braiding is going mainstream

programme.title: The Lenny Henry Show
programme.desc: A classic edition of the sketch show, introducing boxer Joe 'Bomber' Baxter and Billy Bradford, the singing comic. From October 1984

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Phantom Thread (2017)
programme.desc: Celebrated British dressmaker Reynolds Woodcock falls in love with Alma, a shy but strong-willed waitress who refuses to conform to his meticulous way of living. Paul Thomas Anderson's Oscar-winning drama, starring Daniel Day-Lewis in his final role before retirement, alongside Vicky Krieps and Lesley Manville

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A stop-and-search leads to the arrest of a serial killer. A police officer's instinct ends in an armed stand-off and a road traffic collision cracks a massive fraud

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: In Art Week, the sewers start by make a skirt inspired by the Modernist movement. In the transformation challenge, the contestants are given canvases painted by local art students and turn them into dresses, making use of the sculptural fabric and painted design. For the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers take inspiration from the 20th Century Surrealist movement to create fantastical outfits for a mind-bending catwalk

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: A driver is ambushed by a carjacking gang outside his home in Birmingham. Data downloaded off their mobile phones helps link the gang to nearly a hundred car thefts and break-ins

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Huw Stephens takes the helm for tonight's double bill with country act the Chicks, who make their debut at Glastonbury this evening. Having formed in 1989 in Dallas, performing bluegrass and country standards, they've evolved over the years, developing their sound to become more contemporary with politically charged lyrics, leading the way as country music's new generation. From The Other Stage, Dermot Kennedy marks his second return to the festival bringing hits from across two number one albums

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Jamz Supernova introduces an hour of reggae and soul from the West Holts Stage. First up, Jamaica's '80s dancehall/reggae star Barrington Levy brings his distinctive voice to the fields of Worthy Farm and a back catalogue of '80s hits. That's followed by Candi Staton, whose hits include 'You Got the Love' and 'Young Hearts Run Free'

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: For the closing hours of this year's festival, Huw Stephens presents Glastonbury's rock and roll finale from the Other Stage. First up and originally from the east coast of America, with a synth and guitar approach to rock and roll, The War on Drugs present their hypnotic neo-psychedelic live experience. Queens of the Stone Age, who last performed at Glastonbury in 2011, close the evening with songs from their eighth studio album, 'In Times New Roman…'

programme.title: We Love Glastonbury
programme.desc: Famous fans recall their favourite performances and stand-out moments from the festival over the years. Noel Gallagher, Self Esteem, Jessie Ware, Nish Kumar, Kerry Godliman, Joe Wicks and more reflect on seeing the likes of Pet Shop Boys, Beyoncé, Janelle Monáe, Foo Fighters, Miley Cyrus and the Killers at the festival

programme.title: Whoever Heard of a Black Artist? Britain's Hidden Art History
programme.desc: Brenda Emmanus follows Sonia Boyce as she prepares an exhibition at Manchester Art Gallery highlighting black and Asian artists who helped shape the history of British art. Featuring interviews with ground-breaking artists from the Windrush generation, 1960s counterculture revolutionaries and members of the Black Art Movement of the 1980s, with contributors including Rasheed Araeen, Lubaina Himid, Yinka Shonibare and Althea McNish

programme.title: Africa Turns the Page: The Novels That Shaped a Continent
programme.desc: Nigerian-born presenter and historian David Olusoga explores the story of the African novel, and a time when writers including Chinua Achebe, Ngugi wa Thiong'o and Wole Soyinka became the conscience of a continent. In their wake, the African novel was to spread around the world - writers of the African diaspora such as Buchi Emecheta and Ben Okri created masterpieces from their adopted home of the United Kingdom. Featuring contributions by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, Aminatta Forna and 2019 Booker winner Bernardine Evaristo

programme.title: The Wonder of Bees with Martha Kearney
programme.desc: The journalist learns about the science, art and culture associated with the honey bee as she builds on her amateur beekeeping skills. With little experience of her own, the presenter must seek a professional's assistance when unexpected snowfall during spring threatens to kill off the bee colonies in her Suffolk garden, before she learns how urban-dwelling bees are thriving at their rural counterparts' expense

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred takes his traction engine to an old friend to get it repaired, before meeting a pattern-maker who owns six similar machines and who takes him on a trip to a local foundry. Fred also visits a steam-powered museum and garden centre, and a family clock-maker, who shows him how cogs are made

programme.title: The Real T-Rex with Chris Packham
programme.desc: Chris Packham embarks on a global journey to discover the truth about the tyrannosaurus rex, which has endured centuries of scientific inaccuracy and Hollywood misrepresentation. The naturalist uses new studies into dinosaur skin, teeth and muscles, as well as groundbreaking insights into its behaviour to create the most accurate CGI representation of the dinosaur ever produced. To help, Chris speaks to experts in birds, biomechanics and alligators, and has access to one of the most complete tyrannosaurus rex skeletons in existence

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Part one of two. Liz Bonnin joins an international team of palaeontologists in the remote badlands of Wyoming as they investigate a mysterious dinosaur graveyard. Packed with over a dozen skeletons including predators such as the fearsome Allosaurus and giants like Diplodocus, as well as fossilised plants and footprints, the site is a treasure trove that is helping to change the way the Jurassic era is seen. The evidence also helps the team to answer why so many dinosaurs came here, and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: Documentary bringing to life the giant predators and strange beasts that roamed Earth almost 100 million years ago, focusing on some of the new species discovered over the past two decades. The opening programme travels to prehistoric North Africa, where the carcharodontosaurus, a lizard-like carnivore with shark-like teeth more than six inches long, and the spinosaurus - at four metres, one of the biggest killers to walk the planet - once battled for supremacy. Narrated by John Hurt

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: How feathered creatures that blur the boundaries between dinosaurs and birds are revolutionising scientists' understanding of life on Earth. Focusing on China, where most of these discoveries are made, the programme features animals such as the epidexipteryx, a predator the size of a pigeon and the most bird-like of any dinosaur, and the eight-metre-long gigantoraptor, revealing their feathers may have been developed for insulation, to intimidate or attract, or even for flight

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: The history of the prehistoric giants, using computer graphics and special effects to portray the Earth as scientists believe it was millions of years ago. The first episode looks at the rise of the earliest dinosaurs and their fight for domination

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: The life-cycle of a diplodocus in the Jurassic period 152 million years ago, when monster-like sauropods dominated the landscape of fern prairies and conifer forests before the advent of flowers, grass and birds. Computer graphics reconstruct the hatching of a young giant and the battle for survival in a world of carnivorous predators

programme.title: Coming Oot! A Fabulous History of Gay Scotland
programme.desc: Documentary using eyewitness testimony, archive footage and historical research to examine the post-war history of Scotland's gay community, charting the Scottish public's radically changing attitudes over the past 70 years. Scotland was over a decade behind England and Wales in decriminalising homosexuality but now has the best gay rights in Europe: nothing short of a revolution

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred takes his traction engine to an old friend to get it repaired, before meeting a pattern-maker who owns six similar machines and who takes him on a trip to a local foundry. Fred also visits a steam-powered museum and garden centre, and a family clock-maker, who shows him how cogs are made

programme.title: The Real T-Rex with Chris Packham
programme.desc: Chris Packham embarks on a global journey to discover the truth about the tyrannosaurus rex, which has endured centuries of scientific inaccuracy and Hollywood misrepresentation. The naturalist uses new studies into dinosaur skin, teeth and muscles, as well as groundbreaking insights into its behaviour to create the most accurate CGI representation of the dinosaur ever produced. To help, Chris speaks to experts in birds, biomechanics and alligators, and has access to one of the most complete tyrannosaurus rex skeletons in existence

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs

Packed with over a dozen skeletons including predators such as the fearsome Allosaurus and giants like Diplodocus, as well as fossilised plants and footprints, the site is a treasure trove that is helping to change the way the Jurassic era is seen. The evidence also helps the team to answer why so many dinosaurs came here, and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago

programme.title: The Wonder of Bees with Martha Kearney
programme.desc: The journalist discovers a bee with deformed wing virus in one of her hives in Suffolk, and receives a master beekeeper's help as she tackles a varroa mite infestation - a significant factor in the decline of the insects in the UK. Then, as spring arrives, the presenter watches as larvae emerge, before she considers how the use of pesticides may be to blame for the reduction in honey bees

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred meets fellow traction engine enthusiasts in Staffordshire and visits an old friend who is restoring a triple expansion engine at Bratch Pumping Station. He also takes a tour of the trains on the Severn Valley railway and learns about the history of mining in the Black Country at the Living Museum

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: The comedian has to share his hotel room with a yodeller and a horn player, and is then arrested and thrown into a cell with Kenneth Williams

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Thelma looks on with disapproval as Terry helps Bob move his most treasured possessions to his new house, releasing a flood of nostalgic memories about their youthful misadventures. Comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam

programme.title: Kenneth Williams: Fantabulosa!
programme.desc: Michael Sheen takes the lead role in a drama based on Kenneth Williams' diaries. The film charts the comic actor's professional successes, which included the Carry On series, radio programmes such as Round the Horne and numerous TV appearances. It also delves behind the laughter to explore the actor's problems, insecurity and self-doubt

programme.title: Comic Roots
programme.desc: A 1983 documentary in which Kenneth Williams explores his roots, including the slum architecture in and around London's St Pancras district where he grew up, his grandma's fruity anecdotes and the musical knees-up of the local pub

programme.title: What Do Artists Do All Day?
programme.desc: Best known for Nelson's Ship in a Bottle, which appeared on the fourth plinth in Trafalgar Square, Yinka Shonibare is one of Britain's foremost contemporary artists, rising to fame as part of the 'Sensation' generation in the early 1990s. Here, Yinka creates a new 'mannequin' figure and talks about his career

programme.title: Johnny Kingdom: A Year on Exmoor
programme.desc: A quiet January for the amateur cameraman soon turns busy when wild boar become loose in the Devonshire countryside, bringing Britain's media to the area. Johnny also films spoonbills, finding a unique way to get close to the migrating birds

programme.title: Johnny Kingdom: A Year on Exmoor
programme.desc: Spring proves a busy time for the amateur cameraman, but his mind is elsewhere as his pet deer Bambi falls sick. Johnny rescued the three-legged animal 12 years ago, but her illness leaves him facing a difficult decision

programme.title: From Ice to Fire: The Incredible Science of Temperature
programme.desc: Physicist Helen Czerski explores the science of temperature. She begins by venturing to the bottom of the scale, revealing how cold has shaped the world and why frozen does not necessarily mean what people might think

programme.desc: Disa's family comes from the Scandinavian country, Sweden. She is baking kardemummabullar, which is a Swedish recipe for cardamom buns. Disa makes a milk mixture, sweetened with honey, and mixes it into flour to make a dough. She then grinds her special ingredient of cardamom into a powder and adds some into the dough and the rest of it into brown sugar. The dough is flattened, the brown sugar and cardamom mix is spread onto the dough and folded in. The dough is then cut into strips and twisted and wrapped into a bun ready to be baked. Will her friends like the cardamom when it's baked in her kardemummabullar?

programme.desc: Jessica's family is from Ukraine, a country found in Eastern Europe. This region is known for a soup called borscht, and Jessica will be making some for her friends. Jessica cooks cabbage and spring onions in oil and then adds them to grated carrot, beetroot, potatoes and a tomato and stock mixture. All of these ingredients are combined in a casserole dish. Once they are stirred together, the casserole dish can be placed in the oven to cook. Jessica wears a traditional Ukrainian outfit and serves drinks in a beautiful drinks dispenser. Borscht is famous for being brightly coloured, so will her friends be able to guess that her special ingredient is beetroot?

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Coverage of the men's singles final in the grass-court tournament at Queen's Club. Italy's Matteo Berrettini prevailed 7-5, 6-4 over Filip Krajinovic of Serbia in last year's showpiece match to lift this trophy for the second year running. The feat put him in good company, with former world number ones Lleyton Hewitt, Andy Roddick and Andy Murray the other players to have won this title two or more times in a row this century

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Alongside his dog Ginny, the celebrated tenor and broadcaster mines BBC Wales's archives of 1977 to present some of that year's TV gold. Highlights include actor Richard Burton visiting his home town and singer Dorothy Squires organising her own tour. Welsh cooking also comes under the spotlight, the One Man and His Dog finals are relived, while there's a singles club in Swansea that is born from the loneliness of divorce

programme.desc: Lauren Laverne presents two more of today's performances from the Pyramid Stage. Rick Astley makes his Glastonbury debut with a mass singalong of 1980s hits, while New York punk pop legends Blondie will be taking to the stage with classic numbers from their five decade long career

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Rare Breed Survival Trust, a charity founded by his father to reverse the decline of rare breed numbers in the UK. With summer temperatures rising, Adam welcomes a shearing gang on site to remove the coats of his commercial sheep, and is visited by the Chief Executive of the British Pig Association. Plus, a Gloucester Bull is prepared for a day at a country show

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: The final episode explores the challenges that ocean life must overcome, including baby elephant seals and humpback whales endangered as their mothers end up surrounded by males vying for supremacy. A lone sealion chases tuna, one of the fastest fish in the ocean. Not only must it find a way of catching this enormous fish, but it must do so whilst fighting off hungry sharks

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce hosts from Woodhorn Museum in Northumberland. Treasures brought in to be valued include a gold Rolex 'President' wristwatch from the 1980s and a grotesque ceramic animal sculpture made by the eccentric Martin Brothers. Suzanne Zack is enchanted by a beautifully rendered pencil portrait by British artist Henry Ryland, while John Foster falls for a small Roman figure uncovered by a metal detectorist. Plus, Fiona learns tells the story of coal mining and the miners' way of life in the north-east of England

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo, Lauren Laverne, Jack Saunders and Jo Whiley present the historic final performance of this year's festival, as Elton John makes his Glastonbury debut with a set that also marks the last show of his final UK tour. With a career of hits spanning over five decades, it's guaranteed to be a spectacular and emotional swan song to one of the world's greatest showmen

programme.title: Tulip Fever (2017)
programme.desc: In 17th-century Amsterdam at the height of tulip mania, an artist falls in love with a married woman whose portrait he has been commissioned to paint. Historical romance based on Deborah Moggach's novel, starring Alicia Vikander, Dane DeHaan and Jack O'Connell

programme.title: Countryfile Summer Diaries
programme.desc: John Craven explores Poldark country on the north Cornwall coast, and Keeley Donovan reports from the beach in Scarborough as she discovers how people need to be more sun savvy. Paul Martin is in Surrey with actor and animal rights champion Jenny Seagrove. Horse-mad since she was a youngster, Jenny has turned her passion into a mission to rescue abandoned ponies and horses

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Tommy Walsh follow the progress of properties in the process of changing hand. Tommy is by the seaside in the Norfolk village of Eccles on Sea to see a very unusual, wooden constructed property that he fears may be beyond salvation. He's also in Islington, north London, living the high life at a two-bed flat situated in one of the upper floors of a high-rise building. Dion is in Sheffield to view an intriguing auction lot comprising of three terraced houses

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: Money for Nothing

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Bettina and Baljinder want to transform their tired empty plot into a fun, quirky, sociable spot. Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill head to Tadley, Hampshire, to bring bright colour and 'wow factor' to the couple's garden, within a £4,000 budget

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Irita Marriott take a ride around Suffolk and Norfolk, purchasing bargains including a damaged Stoneware Doulton flask and a 19th-century automaton

programme.title: Pointless
