programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway walks the Clywedog Valley Trail near Wrexham in North Wales. He learns the story of John Wilkinson, known as Iron Mad Jack, who revolutionised the iron industry and helps carve a duck from a cedar log. Meanwhile, wildlife expert Lizzie Daly discovers red squirrels are on a comeback in the area and Onkar Singh Purewal is blown away by the rare varieties of apples being grown on the National Trust's Erddig Estate

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: From spy balloons to secret police stations to dissidents on the run, Panorama investigates China's global surveillance operation. The film reveals new details about Beijing's fleet of spy balloons and hacks a Chinese-made security camera to show how similar devices that line our streets could be exploited

programme.title: Rose Ayling-Ellis: Signs for Change
programme.desc: The actress presents a personal journey into the deaf experience, and asks how attitudes are changing in light of British Sign Language being officially recognised in law. The film follows her through performing Shakespeare's As You Like It, and reflects on her time as the first regular deaf character in EastEnders and deaf contestant and winner of Strictly Come Dancing. She also meets with a charity that teaches deaf children to speak, and Rose explores how technology plays a role in the lives of deaf people

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rookie Nurses
programme.desc: Leah is faced with her biggest challenge yet when one of her patients confesses that he wants to die. Angelo tries to keep up with a ward full of patients and Mikey thinks he has seen it all until a man comes in to A&E after being run over by his wife. Gina and Issie reflect on the huge progress their stroke patients have made

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: When former child soldier Baba rescues Freddy from a sexual assault, something dark is ignited in them. The pair's lust for each other takes over and creates a truly deadly duo. DS Lola Franks and DI Jackson Mendy get thrown together to investigate the murder of the pair's first victim. Jackson's history of working in police anti-corruption infuriates Lola, so too does his firmly held belief that no one can ever be held entirely responsible for their actions. Crime drama, starring Babou Ceesay and Eve Myles

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The finalists must impress in the creative brief to get to the final industry assignment: a masterclass at Harvey Nichols in front of industry heavy weights. One MUA's design comes to them in a dream, another adds a light up effect to their look. One person calls upon Celtic mythology in their look while another brings an aquatic alien to life but at the end of it all one MUA's journey comes to an end at the final hurdle while the remaining three prepare to give a masterclass to an audience of make-up stars including Millie Kendall from the British Beauty Council, Marvel's film and TV make-up designer Lizzie Yianni-Georgiou, fashion brands like ASOS and an array of beauty journalists from all kinds of publications. Who will come out victorious and be named Britain's Next Make-up Star?

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Vick Hope present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A young woman races against the tide as she lies injured in a rock pool after falling 40ft down a cliff on holiday. A girl and her grandfather come close to tragedy on a bike ride

programme.title: Countryfile Summer Diaries
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in the Lake District discovering how recycled nappies and other soft plastics could be the answer to fixing the growing number of potholes in the road network

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion, Tommy and Jacqui meet the new owners of a house in Hednesford, Staffordshire and two retail spaces in Norwich and Weymouth to hear about their development plans

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Leominster, Herefordshire, and visits an antique doll restorer. Experts Kate Bliss and Ochucko Ojiri help out today's teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers nervously await the arrival of a capybara, the largest rodent in the world, and the presenters continue the story of Europe's first southern koala joey, as the staff do everything they can to ensure its survival

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers visits Dunbar Recycling Centre, hoping to uncover three lucrative items amongst the skip-bound trash. He enlists the help of woodworker Bruce Faulseit to repurpose a pair of guitars, whilst blacksmith Kev Paxton has to come up with a creative redesign for a round metal table frame. Meanwhile, JJ sets himself the challenge of revitalising a broken bed

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a keen singer from south-east London find a new home in Cambridgeshire, within a budget of £360,000. Together they explore a range of interesting property possibilities, potential new communities and plenty of countryside

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull head to Neath to create a Cornish-inspired garden for Helen and John. Helen was born in Cornwall, but moved to Wales as a child. The couple are keen to bring a touch of Helen's home county to Port Talbot. Within a £5,000 budget, Charlie and Chris turn this troublesome clay-soiled garden into a Cornish coastal haven

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Irita Marriott travel around Northamptonshire, where items include an art deco trinket box, a 1905 kaleidoscope, a B&B sign and an early Japanese satsuma pot

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Billy is nowhere to be seen on the day of Lola's funeral. Elaine and the Knights prepare for the wake but Anna struggles to keep a secret from her sister. After the funeral, Jay decides to record a final video on Lola's social media to thank her followers for their support

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The school launches their new radio station and Danny uses it as a chance to try to make amends. Myles's actions catch up with him and he is alienated by his peers. Nicky butts heads with Kai while she battles with guilt and Preston is forced to face his demons

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Retired electrician Wayne Bradshaw is a car boot sale enthusiast. His craft-loving wife Sue emotionally reveals that her son Alex is too embarrassed to bring people home to the clutter. Stacey gathers up all their possessions, leading to Sue and Wayne struggling to let go of over 30 years' worth of stuff. Carpenter Rob breathes new life into the family's home by rejigging the kitchen layout and upcycling old but much-loved items. Iwan gives the home a supersized spring clean and organizer Dilly shows the best way to sort out wardrobes

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Grandfather Rights
programme.desc: A comedy short about the future of health and safety. Calum's Grandad insists his driving licence allows him to drive all sorts of 'dangerous' vehicles while Calum doesn't want leave the house without a defibrillator

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: Nate and Mobeen are just weeks from the end of their sentence, but Mobeen's work as one of the prison's 'listeners' gets him into trouble with a terrifying inmate from another wing, a man known simply as Megalodon. While contending with this problem, Mobeen receives a visit from Aqsa, who's getting frustrated with certain aspects of life at medical school. Comedy, starring Guz Khan and Tolu Ogunmefun

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: In the prison infirmary, Mobeen sets out to befriend a man known as Memory Stick and convince him to hand over vital information. He also encounters a doctor, Nida, and there's an instant spark between the two of them. While Mobeen's in the hospital, Nate and Officer Harper develop a 'bromance'. Comedy, starring Guz Khan and Tolu Ogunmefun

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Alberta is thrilled when a super-fan visits the mansion, while Thorfinn convinces Hetty to go on a walk that would hopefully spark a special memory

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Hetty accidentally possesses Jay's body just as he and Sam are about to show Woodstone Mansion to a renowned wedding planner

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: In the first half of a two-part special where the same teams do battle across two episodes, the guests are former Wales cross-code rugby star Scott Quinnell, ex-England goalkeeper Rachel Brown-Finnis, Great Britain sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and world champion swimmer Karen Pickering. With team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.desc: Martin Geissler presents all the main issues from the world of politics and beyond. Big interviews, discussion and analysis on the stories that matter to Scotland

programme.desc: At Detling antiques fair in Kent, Caroline Hawley and Raj Bisram take charge of the teams while Natasha Raskin Sharp takes a tour of one family's collection of novelty teapots

programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Coverage of the men's singles final in the grass-court tournament at Queen's Club. Italy's Matteo Berrettini prevailed 7-5, 6-4 over Filip Krajinovic of Serbia in last year's showpiece match to lift this trophy for the second year running. The feat put him in good company, with former world number ones Lleyton Hewitt, Andy Roddick and Andy Murray the other players to have won this title two or more times in a row this century

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich transform a garden in Bournemouth for young married couple Thomas and Rhiann. They have a budget of £3,000 to create a shady, flower-filled space in their sunny back garden and Tom has a lifelong dream of putting in a massive koi carp pond

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne presents two more of today's performances from the Pyramid Stage. Rick Astley makes his Glastonbury debut with a mass singalong of 1980s hits, while New York punk pop legends Blondie will be taking to the stage with classic numbers from their five decade long career

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Rare Breed Survival Trust, a charity founded by his father to reverse the decline of rare breed numbers in the UK. With summer temperatures rising, Adam welcomes a shearing gang on site to remove the coats of his commercial sheep, and is visited by the Chief Executive of the British Pig Association. Plus, a Gloucester Bull is prepared for a day at a country show

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: The final episode explores the challenges that ocean life must overcome, including baby elephant seals and humpback whales endangered as their mothers end up surrounded by males vying for supremacy. A lone sealion chases tuna, one of the fastest fish in the ocean. Not only must it find a way of catching this enormous fish, but it must do so whilst fighting off hungry sharks

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce hosts from Woodhorn Museum in Northumberland. Treasures brought in to be valued include a gold Rolex 'President' wristwatch from the 1980s and a grotesque ceramic animal sculpture made by the eccentric Martin Brothers. Suzanne Zack is enchanted by a beautifully rendered pencil portrait by British artist Henry Ryland, while John Foster falls for a small Roman figure uncovered by a metal detectorist. Plus, Fiona learns tells the story of coal mining and the miners' way of life in the north-east of England

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo, Lauren Laverne, Jack Saunders and Jo Whiley present the historic final performance of this year's festival, as Elton John makes his Glastonbury debut with a set that also marks the last show of his final UK tour. With a career of hits spanning over five decades, it's guaranteed to be a spectacular and emotional swan song to one of the world's greatest showmen

programme.title: Tulip Fever (2017)
programme.desc: In 17th-century Amsterdam at the height of tulip mania, an artist falls in love with a married woman whose portrait he has been commissioned to paint. Historical romance based on Deborah Moggach's novel, starring Alicia Vikander, Dane DeHaan and Jack O'Connell

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gordon Smart and Michelle Ackerley host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Stadium medics battle to save the life of a football fan who suffers a cardiac arrest on the way to a match. Plus, a family home is destroyed by a car

programme.title: Countryfile Summer Diaries
programme.desc: John Craven explores Poldark country on the north Cornwall coast, and Keeley Donovan reports from the beach in Scarborough as she discovers how people need to be more sun savvy. Paul Martin is in Surrey with actor and animal rights champion Jenny Seagrove. Horse-mad since she was a youngster, Jenny has turned her passion into a mission to rescue abandoned ponies and horses

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Tommy Walsh follow the progress of properties in the process of changing hand. Tommy is by the seaside in the Norfolk village of Eccles on Sea to see a very unusual, wooden constructed property that he fears may be beyond salvation. He's also in Islington, north London, living the high life at a two-bed flat situated in one of the upper floors of a high-rise building. Dion is in Sheffield to view an intriguing auction lot comprising of three terraced houses

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Ardingly in West Sussex, and finds out about a wildlife collection put together by a Victorian naturalist. With experts Jonathan Pratt and Ochuko Ojiri

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble return to Longleat Safari Park, where hopes are rising that the first baby southern koala to be born in Europe will soon arrive. A lion's solitary behaviour puts her in danger from other members of the pride, and a pygmy goat has his first ever bath

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is at Witley recycling centre in Surrey, where she rescues a G-Plan unit, a bookcase and a papasan seat with the help of artist Zoe Murphy and restorer Peter Fournel

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman teams up with an author and writer from west London who wants to pen an exciting new chapter for herself in the Oxfordshire countryside. Away from the property hunt, Nicki visits a small village in the county to find out why it was dubbed 'the kindest village in Britain'

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Bettina and Baljinder want to transform their tired empty plot into a fun, quirky, sociable spot. Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill head to Tadley, Hampshire, to bring bright colour and 'wow factor' to the couple's garden, within a £4,000 budget

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Irita Marriott take a ride around Suffolk and Norfolk, purchasing bargains including a damaged Stoneware Doulton flask and a 19th-century automaton

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Lauren Laverne reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: George goes on a mission in search of answers about Rose and Billy is reeling as he makes the final preparations for Lola's funeral. Tensions rise between Vinny and Finlay and Kathy is not happy with Rocky's pet bird

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: From spy balloons to secret police stations to dissidents on the run, Panorama investigates China's global surveillance operation. The film reveals new details about Beijing's fleet of spy balloons and hacks a Chinese-made security camera to show how similar devices that line our streets could be exploited

programme.title: Scotland's Home of the Year
programme.desc: Judges Anna Campbell Jones, Michael Angus and Banjo Beale choose an overall winner from the six regional finalists at Glasgow's iconic House For An Art Lover, designed by world-renowned architect Charles Rennie Mackintosh. The finalists are Snowdrop House in the North East and Northern Isles, Lochbay in Skye won for the Highlands and Islands, Manor House in the South, Old Manse in the Central region, Kirklee Mansion in Glasgow for the West, and Old Train House in Edinburgh for the East

programme.title: Rose Ayling-Ellis: Signs for Change
programme.desc: The actress presents a personal journey into the deaf experience, and asks how attitudes are changing in light of British Sign Language being officially recognised in law. The film follows her through performing Shakespeare's As You Like It, and reflects on her time as the first regular deaf character in EastEnders and deaf contestant and winner of Strictly Come Dancing. She also meets with a charity that teaches deaf children to speak, and Rose explores how technology plays a role in the lives of deaf people

programme.desc: The 64th series concludes with a show dedicated to outgoing Prime Minister Boris Johnson. Jack Dee hosts, with journalist Janet Street-Porter and comedian Phil Wang joining regular team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop on the panel

programme.desc: John Craven explores Poldark country on the north Cornwall coast, and Keeley Donovan reports from the beach in Scarborough as she discovers how people need to be more sun savvy. Paul Martin is in Surrey with actor and animal rights champion Jenny Seagrove. Horse-mad since she was a youngster, Jenny has turned her passion into a mission to rescue abandoned ponies and horses

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Tommy Walsh follow the progress of properties in the process of changing hand. Tommy is by the seaside in the Norfolk village of Eccles on Sea to see a very unusual, wooden constructed property that he fears may be beyond salvation. He's also in Islington, north London, living the high life at a two-bed flat situated in one of the upper floors of a high-rise building. Dion is in Sheffield to view an intriguing auction lot comprising of three terraced houses

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Ardingly in West Sussex, and finds out about a wildlife collection put together by a Victorian naturalist. With experts Jonathan Pratt and Ochuko Ojiri

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble return to Longleat Safari Park, where hopes are rising that the first baby southern koala to be born in Europe will soon arrive. A lion's solitary behaviour puts her in danger from other members of the pride, and a pygmy goat has his first ever bath

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is at Witley recycling centre in Surrey, where she rescues a G-Plan unit, a bookcase and a papasan seat with the help of artist Zoe Murphy and restorer Peter Fournel

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman teams up with an author and writer from west London who wants to pen an exciting new chapter for herself in the Oxfordshire countryside. Away from the property hunt, Nicki visits a small village in the county to find out why it was dubbed 'the kindest village in Britain'

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Bettina and Baljinder want to transform their tired empty plot into a fun, quirky, sociable spot. Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill head to Tadley, Hampshire, to bring bright colour and 'wow factor' to the couple's garden, within a £4,000 budget

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Irita Marriott take a ride around Suffolk and Norfolk, purchasing bargains including a damaged Stoneware Doulton flask and a 19th-century automaton

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Lauren Laverne reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: George goes on a mission in search of answers about Rose and Billy is reeling as he makes the final preparations for Lola's funeral. Tensions rise between Vinny and Finlay and Kathy is not happy with Rocky's pet bird

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: From spy balloons to secret police stations to dissidents on the run, Panorama investigates China's global surveillance operation. The film reveals new details about Beijing's fleet of spy balloons and hacks a Chinese-made security camera to show how similar devices that line our streets could be exploited

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Creations of the Swansea Yarnbombers adorn postboxes across the Welsh city. This group of women, united by their passion for woolly creations, routinely sneak out under cover of darkness. Their work might appear on a park bench or decorate a tree, but this warm-hearted documentary follows them as they face their biggest challenge - decorating Mumbles pier

programme.title: Rose Ayling-Ellis: Signs for Change
programme.desc: The actress presents a personal journey into the deaf experience, and asks how attitudes are changing in light of British Sign Language being officially recognised in law. The film follows her through performing Shakespeare's As You Like It, and reflects on her time as the first regular deaf character in EastEnders and deaf contestant and winner of Strictly Come Dancing. She also meets with a charity that teaches deaf children to speak, and Rose explores how technology plays a role in the lives of deaf people

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Murder in the Badlands
programme.desc: The stories behind the unsolved murders of four women across four decades in Northern Ireland. The first episode tells the inside story of the murder and disappearance of Lisa Dorrian in 2005, containing powerful testimony from her sister and victims' rights campaigner, Joanne Dorrian

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: When former child soldier Baba rescues Freddy from a sexual assault, something dark is ignited in them. The pair's lust for each other takes over and creates a truly deadly duo. DS Lola Franks and DI Jackson Mendy get thrown together to investigate the murder of the pair's first victim. Jackson's history of working in police anti-corruption infuriates Lola, so too does his firmly held belief that no one can ever be held entirely responsible for their actions. Crime drama, starring Babou Ceesay and Eve Myles

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The finalists must impress in the creative brief to get to the final industry assignment: a masterclass at Harvey Nichols in front of industry heavy weights. One MUA's design comes to them in a dream, another adds a light up effect to their look. One person calls upon Celtic mythology in their look while another brings an aquatic alien to life but at the end of it all one MUA's journey comes to an end at the final hurdle while the remaining three prepare to give a masterclass to an audience of make-up stars including Millie Kendall from the British Beauty Council, Marvel's film and TV make-up designer Lizzie Yianni-Georgiou, fashion brands like ASOS and an array of beauty journalists from all kinds of publications. Who will come out victorious and be named Britain's Next Make-up Star?

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: The 64th series concludes with a show dedicated to outgoing Prime Minister Boris Johnson. Jack Dee hosts, with journalist Janet Street-Porter and comedian Phil Wang joining regular team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop on the panel

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Vick Hope present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A young woman races against the tide as she lies injured in a rock pool after falling 40ft down a cliff on holiday. A girl and her grandfather come close to tragedy on a bike ride

programme.title: Countryfile Summer Diaries
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in the Lake District discovering how recycled nappies and other soft plastics could be the answer to fixing the growing number of potholes in the road network

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion, Tommy and Jacqui meet the new owners of a house in Hednesford, Staffordshire and two retail spaces in Norwich and Weymouth to hear about their development plans

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Leominster, Herefordshire, and visits an antique doll restorer. Experts Kate Bliss and Ochucko Ojiri help out today's teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers nervously await the arrival of a capybara, the largest rodent in the world, and the presenters continue the story of Europe's first southern koala joey, as the staff do everything they can to ensure its survival

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers visits Dunbar Recycling Centre, hoping to uncover three lucrative items amongst the skip-bound trash. He enlists the help of woodworker Bruce Faulseit to repurpose a pair of guitars, whilst blacksmith Kev Paxton has to come up with a creative redesign for a round metal table frame. Meanwhile, JJ sets himself the challenge of revitalising a broken bed

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a keen singer from south-east London find a new home in Cambridgeshire, within a budget of £360,000. Together they explore a range of interesting property possibilities, potential new communities and plenty of countryside

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull head to Neath to create a Cornish-inspired garden for Helen and John. Helen was born in Cornwall, but moved to Wales as a child. The couple are keen to bring a touch of Helen's home county to Port Talbot. Within a £5,000 budget, Charlie and Chris turn this troublesome clay-soiled garden into a Cornish coastal haven

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Irita Marriott travel around Northamptonshire, where items include an art deco trinket box, a 1905 kaleidoscope, a B&B sign and an early Japanese satsuma pot

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Billy is nowhere to be seen on the day of Lola's funeral. Elaine and the Knights prepare for the wake but Anna struggles to keep a secret from her sister. After the funeral, Jay decides to record a final video on Lola's social media to thank her followers for their support

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The school launches their new radio station and Danny uses it as a chance to try to make amends. Myles's actions catch up with him and he is alienated by his peers. Nicky butts heads with Kai while she battles with guilt and Preston is forced to face his demons

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Retired electrician Wayne Bradshaw is a car boot sale enthusiast. His craft-loving wife Sue emotionally reveals that her son Alex is too embarrassed to bring people home to the clutter. Stacey gathers up all their possessions, leading to Sue and Wayne struggling to let go of over 30 years' worth of stuff. Carpenter Rob breathes new life into the family's home by rejigging the kitchen layout and upcycling old but much-loved items. Iwan gives the home a supersized spring clean and organizer Dilly shows the best way to sort out wardrobes

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: The devastating impact of the conflict is explored through the stories of three women, as IRA prisoners begin their hunger strike in protest against Margaret Thatcher's policies. Tit for tat killings, car bombs and assassinations became commonplace in Northern Ireland and fatigue from a population desperate for a respite from the cycle of violence creeps in

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: In the first half of a two-part special where the same teams do battle across two episodes, the guests are former Wales cross-code rugby star Scott Quinnell, ex-England goalkeeper Rachel Brown-Finnis, Great Britain sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and world champion swimmer Karen Pickering. With team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: Nate and Mobeen are just weeks from the end of their sentence, but Mobeen's work as one of the prison's 'listeners' gets him into trouble with a terrifying inmate from another wing, a man known simply as Megalodon. While contending with this problem, Mobeen receives a visit from Aqsa, who's getting frustrated with certain aspects of life at medical school. Comedy, starring Guz Khan and Tolu Ogunmefun

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: In the prison infirmary, Mobeen sets out to befriend a man known as Memory Stick and convince him to hand over vital information. He also encounters a doctor, Nida, and there's an instant spark between the two of them. While Mobeen's in the hospital, Nate and Officer Harper develop a 'bromance'. Comedy, starring Guz Khan and Tolu Ogunmefun

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Alberta is thrilled when a super-fan visits the mansion, while Thorfinn convinces Hetty to go on a walk that would hopefully spark a special memory

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Hetty accidentally possesses Jay's body just as he and Sam are about to show Woodstone Mansion to a renowned wedding planner

programme.title: Women and Gambling: My Secret Addiction
programme.desc: Over the last five years, the number of women seeking help for gambling addiction has more than doubled in the UK, according to the charity GambleAware. As many women grapple with the stigma of addiction, the BBC has been given exclusive access to the first women's residential treatment centre for gambling, based in central England. In this film, Rachel Stonehouse explores the issues around women and gambling addiction, both in the UK and around the world, and asks why it is a secret for so many.

programme.title: Women and Gambling: My Secret Addiction
programme.desc: Over the last five years, the number of women seeking help for gambling addiction has more than doubled in the UK, according to the charity GambleAware. As many women grapple with the stigma of addiction, the BBC has been given exclusive access to the first women's residential treatment centre for gambling, based in central England. In this film, Rachel Stonehouse explores the issues around women and gambling addiction, both in the UK and around the world, and asks why it is a secret for so many.

programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Lloyd finds a discarded leg behind the washing machine, he is mistakenly declared a hero for defeating a bloodthirsty spider. Unable to resist the praise and free comics, Lloyd goes along with it... but he's then confronted by an actual spider.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd finds an entire sweetie, but when he is unable to move it on his own, he reluctantly leaves it in the care of a passing wasp while he gets Abacus and PB. When the wasp steals the sweetie and takes it to their nest, Lloyd then gathers a team to stage a sweet-retrieving heist!

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The heroes of International Rescue must deal with emergencies on two fronts when an orbiting solar energy station malfunctions, placing a passing airliner - and its precious cargo - in peril

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The Spuds take the camper van on holiday, and end up at the bottom of the sea. Dave has to resort to a resourceful solution to get help.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave rescues an endangered donkey from the docks. Hiding it in the camper van, things take a turn when the donkey eats Gran's glasses.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Brick decides to launch the quest for the golden sock! It's a treasure hunt in the forest. The hunt is mapped out through riddles based on school lessons from that year. The first one to find the sock gets to choose where the next field trip will be! Since he hasn't studied, Mo decides to ask for the power to know everything the Internet knows. But with the half power, the scepter materialises the Internet under the form of a little boy and a little girl...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. City Hall set up a day for kids to pick up litter in the city. Noomi sees this as her chance to spend a romantic day with Mo. But Mo has one thing only on his mind: the top level in his video game! All he has to do is cross the bridge, fight the last duel and he'll win! But it's hopeless: every time, Mo botches this ultimate challenge. He requests the Scepter to grant him the power to enter his video game and cross the bridge for real!

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Jump into the Mystery Machine for more comedic mystery-solving adventures with Scooby and the gang. Legendary game show host Alex Trebek hosts an episode of the quiz show Jeopardy! featuring Velma and Shaggy competing against a robot called Max Kilobyte, who goes on a rampage against anyone that looks like they might cause him to lose the game.

programme.title: Martin Clunes: Islands of America
programme.desc: The actor arrives in New York to explore Manhattan Island, and its Empire State Building, from where he can see the city's 500 miles of coastline and more than 40 islands. He later takes the ferry to Ellis Island, which opened in 1892 as an immigration centre for those arriving in the US by sea. Following a trip to Coney Island, home to the iconic amusement park, he explores Martha's Vineyard more than 200 miles away, where Jaws was made. Martin ends his trip in Maine, America's most easterly state, with hundreds of islands off its coast

programme.title: Fishing Allstars
programme.desc: Dean Macey and Adam Rooney travel across Italy, with their main target a monster wels catfish of up to 300lbs in the River Po. They also aim to catch smaller channel catfish from the River Arno and carp from a stunning mountain lake near Bologna

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny takes to the water on a surf simulator as he attempts a 360 degree spin!

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Lloyd finds a discarded leg behind the washing machine, he is mistakenly declared a hero for defeating a bloodthirsty spider. Unable to resist the praise and free comics, Lloyd goes along with it... but he's then confronted by an actual spider.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd finds an entire sweetie, but when he is unable to move it on his own, he reluctantly leaves it in the care of a passing wasp while he gets Abacus and PB. When the wasp steals the sweetie and takes it to their nest, Lloyd then gathers a team to stage a sweet-retrieving heist!

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The heroes of International Rescue must deal with emergencies on two fronts when an orbiting solar energy station malfunctions, placing a passing airliner - and its precious cargo - in peril

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The Spuds take the camper van on holiday, and end up at the bottom of the sea. Dave has to resort to a resourceful solution to get help.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave rescues an endangered donkey from the docks. Hiding it in the camper van, things take a turn when the donkey eats Gran's glasses.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Brick decides to launch the quest for the golden sock! It's a treasure hunt in the forest. The hunt is mapped out through riddles based on school lessons from that year. The first one to find the sock gets to choose where the next field trip will be! Since he hasn't studied, Mo decides to ask for the power to know everything the Internet knows. But with the half power, the scepter materialises the Internet under the form of a little boy and a little girl...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. City Hall set up a day for kids to pick up litter in the city. Noomi sees this as her chance to spend a romantic day with Mo. But Mo has one thing only on his mind: the top level in his video game! All he has to do is cross the bridge, fight the last duel and he'll win! But it's hopeless: every time, Mo botches this ultimate challenge. He requests the Scepter to grant him the power to enter his video game and cross the bridge for real!

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Jump into the Mystery Machine for more comedic mystery-solving adventures with Scooby and the gang. Legendary game show host Alex Trebek hosts an episode of the quiz show Jeopardy! featuring Velma and Shaggy competing against a robot called Max Kilobyte, who goes on a rampage against anyone that looks like they might cause him to lose the game.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team are in Hemel Hempstead, Hertfordshire, where they meet deaf couple Asif Iqbal and wife Sabina. programme.title: Rio 2 (2014)
programme.desc: Parrots Jewel and Blu lead a happy life together in Rio with their three chicks, until they find themselves hurled into an expedition up the Amazon. The journey leads to an encounter with an old enemy, while Blu also has to win the approval of Jewel's fearsome father. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jesse Eisenberg, Anne Hathaway and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: Love Bites
programme.desc: Scarlett Moffatt is back with her delicious fusion of dating and cooking. Three singletons battle it out in the kitchen of love to win a date with 26-year-old Ayca

programme.desc: Three suitors buy an outfit for fashion entrepreneur Caz, who then goes on a date with the person whose taste in clothes they liked best

programme.title: Dress to Impress

Along with the classic Supermarket Sweep quizzes, trolley dashes and pastel jumpers, the revamped show features exciting new games, challenges and some famous faces.

programme.desc: The quiz return after a break with Gino D'Acampo hosting as the Dayalans from Oxfordshire go up against the Bibbys from St Helen, trying to guess the most popular responses to surveys posed to 100 people for a chance to win a £30,000 jackpot prize

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. programme.desc: Cheeky eight-year-old Alex Pruitt is delighted to be given a remote-controlled toy car by his neighbour - unaware it contains a stolen microchip. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Geraldine McEwan makes her last appearance as the spinster sleuth before handing over the knitting needles to Julia McKenzie. Following the death of old acquaintance Mr Rafiel, Miss Marple receives instructions drawn up prior to his demise asking her to embark on a coach tour to investigate an unspecified possible crime. It soon transpires that many of her companions are also travelling at his invitation and they are all in some way connected to a girl who went missing from a nun's sanctuary during World War Two, supposedly to be with her German lover, Rafiel's son Michael. Murder mystery, with a star-studded supporting cast including Richard E Grant, Johnny Briggs, Amanda Burton, Anne Reid, Ronni Ancona, George Cole, Will Mellor and Laura Michelle Kelly

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: When a business magnate, his wife and their maid are murdered, Miss Marple (Julia McKenzie) is prompted by the circumstances surrounding the incidents to recall the nursery rhyme Sing a Song of Sixpence. She discovers the victims were part of a family tainted by secrets, and as she ponders the significance of the tune, a past scandal reveals itself. Murder mystery, featuring Wendy Richard as feisty cook Mrs Crump, in her final dramatic role. Other guest stars include Prunella Scales, Matthew Macfadyen, Ralf Little, Rupert Graves and Helen Baxendale

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Ever since a beautiful American woman arrived in the peaceful village of Wychwood-under-Ashe, people have begun to die in a series of apparent accidents. Nobody suspects a killer is at work but, as the body count rises, Miss Marple digs a little deeper with the help of a former policeman - and they gradually unearth a secret that will rock the village to its core. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, Benedict Cumberbatch, David Haig, Sylvia Syms, Margo Stilley and Hugo Speer

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are asked to restore an ornate water garden cascade in the grounds of a health spa, where they are invited to join owner Frances Caldecott and her children for dinner. That evening, the duo discover Frances has been strangled and her jewellery stolen, and set out to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Ormerod finally accepts that wife Caroline isn't going to emerge from her coma and decides to move on. Starring Michael Starke, Amy Robbins and Robert Daws, and featuring a guest appearance by Tricia Penrose in her Heartbeat guise of Gina Ward

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A student nurse causes quite a stir when she arrives in the middle of the night, while Ken and Alun contend with a farming family suffering a crisis. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The bobbies of Aidensfield try to get to the bottom of a series of burglaries in which the culprit only steals certain valuable objects, including Tricia's postcard collection. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Paying guests the Langleys arrive for a shooting party at Ashfordly Hall, but their grandiose ideas upset the locals and it is not long before a sinister plot is revealed. Vernon's latest money-making scheme seems destined to end in disaster as David takes the wheel of an old Army vehicle, but his off-road tours are not for the faint-hearted. Nostalgic rural drama, guest starring Robert Glenister and Celia Imrie

programme.desc: Time is finally running out for Richard. Gail has got wind of the police's new evidence and, having pieced all the facts together, she decides it's time to confront her husband

programme.desc: The sleuth is reunited with sidekick Captain Hastings (Hugh Fraser), secretary Miss Lemon (Pauline Moran) and Inspector Japp (Philip Jackson) in a case that plunges him into the world of global espionage as the Second World War looms. The public are in panic after the shocking death of Russian grandmaster Ivan Savaranoff during a game of chess. Poirot must try to determine the good guys from the bad in a complex plot that sees the main figures used like pawns. David Suchet stars in a story adapted by Mark Gatiss and Ian Hallard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A father is aghast to read tales of wild romance in his teenage daughter's diary, failing to realise they are all fictitious. Nostalgic drama, starring David Lonsdale and Tricia Penrose

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina is suspected of being a hit-and-run driver, while Vernon is hired to escort two singers to a gig - but soon discovers he has an aversion to loud music and offloads the responsibility onto David, who is no match for the conniving pair

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

Starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Cliff Parisi

programme.desc: A tragic communication error between officers leaves gay police constable Nick Bentley caught in the crossfire of armed drug dealers, with no back-up. Crime drama, starring Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Harriet Walter

To his amazement, there are strings inside the piano that he plucks. He taps them and the sounds of the piano ring out. How wonderful. It's a little like a harp in a big box.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape

Finally he reaches the white city of Ostuni and after trying his hand at painting the city walls, the chef creates his version of tiramisu, Italy's most famous dessert - will it meet with the approval of the city's painters?

programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole head to Dumfries to meet recently retired Mary, who is looking to downsize. Items uncovered include a horse trap and a broken one-arm bandit

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Liverpool, Jude and her husband Malcolm hope a selection of their restaurant favourites will win them the prize. However, as the evening pans out, Malcolm turns out to be less of a help and more of a hindrance. On day two, Kelsey and Chris hope to spice up their guests' lives with a Mexican fiesta. A confession from Malcolm about what he gets up to while Jude is at the bingo leaves her fuming, and Elisa's revelation about a celebrity crush leaves her boyfriend Alan speechless. The final hosts, Alan and Elisa, have dished out blunt feedback all week, so their guests could be out for revenge

programme.title: Chateau DIY

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.desc: Romeo is desperate to make amends with Peri, but his plans might be derailed when his girlfriend Rayne discovers a revealing message on his phone

programme.title: Ben Elton: The Great Railway Disaster
programme.desc: The comedian argues that railway privatisation is a failed experiment, travelling through Manchester's Ordsall Chord, an £85 million feat of engineering which currently only runs one train in each direction per hour, and experiencing Britain's worst railway line, the Transpennine Express. Ben reveals the results of a Channel 4 survey which asked 2,000 adults about their experience of using the trains, questioning how problems on the railways have impacted people's everyday lives, changing the way they travel

programme.title: Before We Die
programme.desc: Bianca is reunited with her mother Dubravka against her will, and quickly becomes a prisoner in her own home. Christian tries to evade the Mimicas and get back to the UK undetected to save her. Hannah and Billy have uncovered the mole and struck a deal with him to reveal all before Dubravka can intervene

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Chris McCausland is joined by comedian and presenter Tom Allen in Rome, where they eat ice cream before it melts, zip around the city on a rickety Vespa, train to be gladiators, learn to sing opera and make pasta from scratch. And will Tom's one-of-a-kind commentary do the Colosseum justice for Chris?

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: Larry Dean: Fandan
programme.desc: The double Edinburgh Comedy Award nominee performs his debut special, recorded in his hometown of Glasgow. He takes us through his attempt to win friends through bank robbery, getting tea with murderers and memorable misdemeanours in a Dubai hotel room. Larry journeys through ghosting, battling the organised partner in relationships, and announcing his sexuality with a bang - in a proudly Scottish voice

programme.title: The Extraordinary Life of April Ashley
programme.desc: Documentary about the transgender model, dancer and restaurateur, whose life took her from the slums of wartime Liverpool to the height of Knightsbridge society. In the late 1950s, April became a dancer in an infamous Parisian nightclub, before travelling to Casablanca to undergo pioneering gender reassignment surgery. Returning to Britain, she became a model for Vogue before being outed by a tabloid newspaper. From then on, her life was a rollercoaster involving celebrity friendships, a landmark divorce trial and an MBE for services to transgender equality

programme.title: Iris Prize Best British Shorts
programme.desc: Jason Barker's Iris Prize-nominated short film The P**s Witch. Fed up with the judgement of her peers and cruel comments about her body, Clare finds power in rebellion

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in New Jersey to help Rose Leone, who spent two years in a coma and came out of hospital to learn her son Michael had run her once-thriving Italian restaurant into the ground. With a menu of more than 126 dishes, the quality of the food is suffering, and even the chefs refuse to eat their own creations

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets actor Sean Simons, who has bought the ruins of Cloontykilla Castle in Co Roscommon with a view to using them to create a spectacular mock 16th-century home. However, the outlandish plans - including Jacuzzis in the battlements and water-spouting gargoyles - have Kevin worried the project could become a garish nightmare, and his scepticism increases when he realises Sean has not consulted an architect. Disaster seems to be looming as the contractors grow frustrated and planning regulations are ignored, but somehow things slowly begin to take shape - until a national economic crisis plunges everything into chaos

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke delves into the world of ingenious small builds, meeting people creating places to live, work and play in the most unlikely of places. Here he meets a couple who turned an old fire engine into a bar to raise money for firefighters' charities and a 23-year-old who built a shepherd's hut from scratch, including the nuts and bolts. George also visits an extraordinary home in Chile and Will Hardie builds a telescope

programme.desc: Doug goes into hospital to have his appendix removed - but while sedated, he unwittingly reveals a catalogue of sexual fantasies, none of which involve Carrie

programme.title: Before We Die

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: The full story of Boris Johnson's friendship with press baron Evgeny Lebedev and his former KGB spy father, Alexander Lebedev. Including exclusive interviews with intelligence officials and senior political figures who warned the former Prime Minister against the friendship, knowing it would put him 'in a direct line of being able to be influenced and compromised'. Despite being told by both Britain's security services and the House of Lords Appointments Commission that the friendship was dangerous, Johnson ignored this advice and became the first Prime Minister to over-rule intelligence advice related to national security for a parliamentary nomination

programme.title: Dr Death

programme.title: Untold: The Secrets of UK Prisons
programme.desc: David Navarro, a former inmate himself, exposes the truth behind life in a UK prison. Through personal experience and footage recorded using illegal mobile phones, Navarro investigates the bullying, drugs, fights, weapons and self-harm that is running rife through jails across the country. Plus, an interview with the former Secretary of State for Justice Robert Buckland

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Nurse Emma is called to resus to help 71-year-old Thomas who has had a suspected stroke, and has a narrow window of time to give Thomas a life-saving drug. While treating him, Emma tells us the story of how she went from working in a dry-cleaners as a teenager to pursuing a career as a stroke nurse. At the same time, 88-year-old Mary is rushed to St George's after falling at home and injuring her head

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: The Change

programme.title: The Change

Their first stop in County Clare is a miniature modern marvel called Teeroneer, a timber-clad, prize-winning property with a sunken kitchen that Sandi just can't resist cooking in. From there the pair head to Ark Ranch Treehouse. Hand-built by one woman, Sandi and Eddie are charmed by the sense of childhood adventure they feel. programme.title: Ancient Egypt by Train with Alice Roberts

The towns along the railway line each have their very own Ancient Egyptian temple. Alice finishes up taking a boat to see the extraordinary Philae Temple that was rebuilt in the 1970s due to flooding caused by the Aswan dam

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Steve is involved in a dangerous high-speed pursuit of a car stolen in a burglary. Claire and Tom deal with an abusive drunk driver who is clueless about what he has done wrong, rookie Omar tackles a fence-hopping suspect whose antics have left him with a slashed hand, and Steve tracks down a car suspected of being involved in a robbery

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dog handler Duncan attends a midnight stand-off between armed officers and a man who has been seen carrying knives, Suggs pulls over a motorist who appears incapable of telling the truth, and Charlie is given the unenviable task of removing a Range Rover from a ditch after a crash

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: Today, the Tower of London is kept pristinely clean, but it has a dirty past. For centuries, all its rubbish was chucked into the River Thames, but, as chief curator Tracy Borman discovers, yesterday's trash is today's treasure. She joins a team of archaeologists on the foreshore for a once-in-a-decade survey, and makes some remarkable finds, from thousand-year-old pottery to ancient armour

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London

programme.title: Jay Blades' East End Through Time
programme.desc: Jay concludes his exploration of the history of London's East End, this time focusing on the 20th century and life in the East End during the Second World War. He meets with local historian Kate Thompson, who paints a picture of how areas such as Bethnal Green coped during the blitz, before 93-year-old Babs Clark tells him the story of how 173 people were crushed to death in what was one of the worst civilian tragedies of the war. Later, he meets former Krays firm member Chris Lambrianou at the notorious Blind Beggar pub to get an insider's take on the infamous Kray twins, before making his way to Canary Wharf to see how parts of London have been completely transformed over the decades

programme.title: 999: Emergency Call Out

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.desc: Much of Florida sits on porous rock that is easily eroded and prone to collapse, leading the Sunshine State to be hit by 1,700 sinkholes every year. Cameras reveal what it's like to live in an area where the ground could collapse beneath your feet at any moment

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A look at what makes a great GP, hearing from doctors and medical staff first-hand about what it is like to work on the NHS frontline and what it takes for them to be good at their job. Baby Arissa has been brought in after a long night of crying by her concerned mum Saba, and Patrick comes in to have his large itchy moles checked over by Sobia. A young man is treated for a possible infection in his leg following a car crash

programme.title: Divine Designs

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Rubble falls asleep while reading a storybook about Buddy the hiccuping dragon. He cannot believe his eyes when Buddy jumps right out of the story and plays a game of hide-and-seek throughout Adventure Bay

programme.title: Snoopy and Charlie Brown: The Peanuts Movie (2015)
programme.desc: The long-suffering youngster hopes his lifelong run of bad luck will come to an end when he develops a crush on a new schoolfriend. His beloved dog has more important things to worry about, as he dreams of taking to the skies in his airborne kennel. Animated comedy, with the voices of Noah Schnapp and Bill Melendez

programme.title: Bee Movie (2007)
programme.desc: A bee wearies of a life dedicated to producing honey and decides to leave his hive. During his foray into the wider world, he befriends a florist. However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock

programme.title: Zathura: A Space Adventure (2005)
programme.desc: Two squabbling brothers with time on their hands decide to play a mysterious old board game after finding it in their basement. A chance roll of the dice sends their house into deep space, where they must battle with aliens and work together to stay alive. Family sci-fi adventure, starring Josh Hutcherson, Jonah Bobo, Kristen Stewart, Tim Robbins and Dax Shepard

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo (2011)
programme.desc: A father-of-two struggling to cope with the death of his wife is in need of a fresh start, so buys a house with a dilapidated zoo on the grounds. With the help of the keepers, he works to restore the attraction to its former glory, while also trying to reconnect with his troubled teenage son. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson and Thomas Haden Church

programme.title: I, Robot (2004)
programme.desc: The inventor of an advanced form of intelligent robot is found dead, and the detective investigating the case is certain that one of the scientist's mechanical creations is responsible - but no one believes his theory because the robots have been programmed to prevent them from harming humans. Sci-fi thriller, inspired by the Isaac Asimov stories, starring Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Tudyk

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981)
programme.desc: Intrepid archaeologist Indiana Jones goes in search of the legendary Ark of the Covenant, a biblical artefact of devastating power. His quest leads him to Egypt, where the Nazis are plotting to use the Ark to further Hitler's plans for world domination - aided by Jones's deceitful French rival. The first of five big-screen action adventures, starring Harrison Ford as Indy, with Karen Allen, Paul Freeman and John Rhys-Davies

programme.title: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan (1982)
programme.desc: The Enterprise crew faces a bitter battle to the death with an old enemy. Khan, a genetically engineered superhuman tyrant, has escaped exile on a barren planet and hijacked a starship to take his revenge on Admiral Kirk, while also scheming to turn an experimental planet-creating device into a doomsday weapon. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, Ricardo Montalban and Kirstie Alley

programme.title: Ema (2019)
programme.desc: An estranged couple struggle with the aftermath of giving up their adopted son, despite the violent acts he committed. Haunting drama, starring Gael García Bernal, Mariana Di Girólamo and Cristián Suárez. In Spanish with English subtitles

programme.title: Red Mountain (1951)
programme.desc: A Confederate captain sets out to join forces with notorious guerilla militia Quantrill's Raiders, but stops off en route to rescue a man from being lynched for a murder he himself committed - and complicates matters by falling for his fiancee. Western set during the American Civil War, starring Alan Ladd and Lizabeth Scott

programme.title: O.S.S. (1946)
programme.desc: A spy is parachuted into France shortly before D-Day to complete a perilous top-secret mission. His team of expert operatives includes a strong-minded female agent - but sparks fly when the pair begin to work together, a situation which looks likely to lead to a crisis of conscience. Second World War adventure, starring Alan Ladd, Geraldine Fitzgerald, Patric Knowles and Richard Benedict

programme.title: 7th Cavalry (1956)
programme.desc: An army officer is branded a coward for failing to fight in the Battle of the Little Bighorn, and is unable to convince anyone that official business had detained him. In a bid to repair his damaged reputation, he leads a cavalry detail to retrieve the dead from the battlefield. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Jay C Flippen and Jeanette Nolan

programme.title: Strategic Air Command (1955)
programme.desc: A pilot relishes the opportunity to return to the baseball pitch once the Second World War is over. However, his sporting career is put on hold when he's drafted back into the US Air Force and given the opportunity to fly a revolutionary new jet. Drama, starring James Stewart, Frank Lovejoy, Barry Sullivan, Alex Nicol and June Allyson

programme.title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock (1984)
programme.desc: Admiral Kirk and his crew hijack the decommissioned Enterprise to recover the body of their fallen comrade Mr Spock from the planet Genesis. Kirk has learnt that Spock's spirit is still alive, and the Vulcan can be resurrected, but he must also battle a Klingon captain determined to control the planet's mysterious energy. Sci-fi sequel, directed by Leonard Nimoy, with William Shatner, DeForest Kelley and Christopher Lloyd

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom (1984)
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist, with his young sidekick and a nightclub singer in tow, is stranded in India, where he takes on a mission to recover magical sacred stones from the hands of an evil cult engaged in human sacrifice and child slavery. Steven Spielberg's action adventure, starring Harrison Ford, Kate Capshaw, Ke Huy Quan and Amrish Puri

programme.title: The Novice (2021)
programme.desc: Alex Dall is an obsessive college freshman who joins her university's rowing team. She undertakes an extreme physical and psychological journey to make it to the top varsity boat, no matter the cost. Drama, starring Isabelle Fuhrman and Amy Forsyth

programme.title: The Florida Project (2017)
programme.desc: A six-year-old girl roams the grounds of the motel where she lives with her mother, looking for adventure with her small band of friends. Manager Bobby keeps a protective eye on the children, but his affection for them becomes strained as their mischief escalates. Drama, starring Willem Dafoe, Brooklynn Prince and Bria Vinaite

programme.title: Apache Uprising (1965)
programme.desc: Western, starring Rory Calhoun as a tough-talking cowboy with a heart of gold who bravely defends fellow stagecoach passengers from a potentially lethal Indian attack. Also starring Corinne Calvet, Lon Chaney Jr and John Russell

programme.title: Appointment with Danger (1950)
programme.desc: A nun is targeted by two murderers when they realise she is the only witness to one of their killings, and it is up to postal inspector to protect her and bring the men to justice. Noir thriller, starring Phyllis Calvert, Alan Ladd and Paul Stewart

programme.title: The War Lover (1962)
programme.desc: Bomber commander Buzz Rickson is respected by his crew for his daredevil abilities in the air, but his personal life is a disaster. His co-pilot initially idolises the fearless airman, but over time becomes increasingly aware of his hero's flaws - especially when Rickson starts pursuing his comrade's girlfriend. Second World War drama, with Steve McQueen, Robert Wagner and Shirley Anne Field

programme.title: Dark Command (1940)
programme.desc: A teacher is defeated in his ambition to become the marshal of his town during the early years of the American Civil War, so he turns renegade instead. Before long he has a reputation as a feared raider fighting on the side of the South, and it falls to the newly appointed lawman whose job he coveted to stop his reign of terror. Western, starring John Wayne and Walter Pidgeon

programme.title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home (1986)
programme.desc: The Enterprise crew travels back in time to prevent an alien probe destroying the Earth. The only thing that can avert the disaster is a humpback whale, a creature extinct in the 23rd century - but adjusting to life back in 1986 proves a distinct challenge. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring William Shatner, DeForest Kelley and Leonard Nimoy, who also directed

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Once reunited, the duo team up to finish the task and locate the sacred relic before the Nazis get their hands on it. Action adventure sequel directed by Steven Spielberg, the third instalment in the successful franchise. Harrison Ford stars as the titular hero, alongside Sean Connery, Alison Doody, River Phoenix, Julian Glover and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: The Kid (2019)
programme.desc: In the Wild West of the 19th century, a youngster named Rio Cutler goes on the run with his sister Sara to escape their violent uncle Grant. Along the way, they meet Billy the Kid and his gang, forming an unlikely alliance with the infamous outlaw. Western adventure directed by Vincent D'Onofrio, starring Chris Pratt, Ethan Hawke, Dane DeHaan and Jake Schur

programme.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier (1989)
programme.desc: The Starship Enterprise races to the rescue of intergalactic ambassadors held hostage on a distant planet. The crisis proves to be the handiwork of a renegade Vulcan mystic who kidnaps Captain Kirk and his crew, ordering them to fly to an unexplored world where he hopes to fulfil his insane ambition - to meet God. Sci-fi adventure, written, directed by and starring William Shatner, with Leonard Nimoy, DeForest Kelley and David Warner

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Elated at being named one of People magazine's '30 to Watch Under 30', Raj makes a pass at Penny and becomes very arrogant, making it hard for Leonard to maintain a positive perspective on his friend's new-found confidence. Guest starring Charlie Sheen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: The architect heads off to Italy, where it seems the residents have also been bitten by the 'small buildings are beautiful' bug. The most spectacular place he visits is so high up in the mountains that it's only accessible by helicopter, but this difficulty is more than made up for by the views seen from it. Back in Britain, George meets a man turning a wrecked private jet into a crash pad and a Gypsy tattoo artist with big plans for an old railway carriage. George also challenges his pal, craftsman Will Hardie, to create a woodland retreat for less than the price of a family holiday

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: Tammy and Stuart live in a pretty village in West Sussex but their bungalow is outdated, with its main living rooms starved of light. The couple are desperate to create a family home but their options are severely limited. Enter architect Will Alsop, who designs a dramatic barrel-vaulted extension to the rear of the bungalow, complete with specially constructed exposed curved beams, an aluminium roof and porthole windows. It's certainly an audacious design - but what will the neighbours think?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George is in Wirral to help retired couple Charles and Ian, who are finally getting round to a complete redesign of their Edwardian home. But will they agree to his radical changes or are they too set in their ways? George also tackles an 1850s country house in Surrey which has accrued some bizarre additions over the years, including a 1970s MDF staircase, a baronial fireplace and a random room that contains nothing but the fuse box

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dry-cleaning manager Valerie hosts the first dinner party in Lancashire, where she plans to impress her guests with a lamb hotpot and trifle. However, it remains to be seen whether her warm-hearted hospitality will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize by the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance teacher Nicky hosts the second night in Lancashire, where she hopes to impress her guests with a round-the-world themed menu inspired by her dancing tours, which includes a Chinese salmon starter, and an American dessert. However, with fellow contestant Peggy born in the United States, the host may have her work cut out in presenting the perfect dish

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Outsourcing manager Steve hosts the third night in Lancashire, where the 51-year-old plans to wow his guests with a 'man of the world' menu that relies heavily on strong Indian spices. Peggy picks him up on his shop-bought black pudding, while Nicky is unimpressed by the mildness of the chicken balti, resulting in a humiliating chilli-sauce challenge

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: American Peggy hosts a USA-themed dinner party on the fourth night of the competition in Lancashire, and hopes her Arizonan recipes will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize. Her menu comprises tried and tested dishes, including her dessert of peach dump cake. However, friction between her and fellow contestant Steve continues to build

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final dinner party in Lancashire, and the turn of sales manager Andy to host. He is confident in his locally sourced gastro menu and delivers a meal with plenty of flair, but faces the challenge of impressing foodie Nicky. He is also under pressure to convince American Peggy of the merits of the region's food, while his fellow Lancastrians Valerie and Steve are keen to see how the area has influenced his cooking

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Church Street Cobbles, a B&B that foodie Debbie Quinn and housekeeper, cook and cleaner Isobel Reisen recently opened above a barber shop in Macclesfield. Guests John and Joy are amazed by the cleanliness, but Steve and Verity aren't impressed with their bathroom. During an afternoon of foraging in the woods, Debbie and Isobel get competitive, while Arun and his sister Rashmi show off their skills. Expectations are high at breakfast, but Debbie's locally sourced produce comes under fire from Steve and Verity, and their feedback is hard to swallow

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to rock 'n' roll venue the Victoria Bikers Pub in Coalville, Leicestershire, where siblings John and Joy take a more laid back approach to running the business

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Cranberries Hideaway in Kilmington, Devon, where owner Steve and his partner Verity hope the luxury touches will win over their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests head to the Mehfil Hotel in Southall, London, where spiritual host Arun and his sister Rashmi are hoping to bring some Indian hospitality to the competition

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for one last time to find out what they have been paid. Debbie and Isobel are keen to get to the bottom of some of the cleaning comments from Steve and Verity

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Michelle Blackett is the host on day three in Glasgow, and hopes to impress the diners by preparing a menu of exceedingly well-appointed food. Over the course of the evening, Michelle's guests discover her hidden heritage, and hospitality student Erwin - who speaks five languages - does his best to add the 'Glaswegian' dialect to his arsenal

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ballet enthusiast and hospitality management student Erwin Orduz hosts the fourth dinner party in Glasgow and hopes to impress his guests with an evening of shocks and surprises. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A category one call comes through for a man bleeding from his ears. But how he got these injuries doesn't ring true for the paramedics. programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A woman has an emotional reunion with her niece after being estranged for 30 years, while another case reveals links to 19th-century Whitechapel and the Jack the Ripper murders

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The search for relatives of an east London lady reveals a connection to arguably the most famous heist of the 20th century, and one heir hunter takes on larger firms in Cheshire

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Farmer's daughter Mandy Sowray and her friend Anny Harrison host first at Laskill Country House in Helmsley, North Yorkshire. Chris Witton and Saroop Ram from the Swan Hotel feel right at home, but tech-savvy Colin and Ben Warburg from Scalford Hall Hotel fail to connect from the start. During the afternoon's hay-bale race, youngsters Charlie Thompson and Lauren Tucker from the Abbey Hotel fail to stack up to the challenge. At dinner, Mandy bigs up her banger qualifications, but at breakfast she fails to crack Chris's order. Colin's feedback leaves unanswered questions for Mandy

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris Witton and his spiritual friend Rammy hope that straightforward value for money will win them the competition, as they host at the Swan Hotel in Telford. A Yorkshire pudding-making competition leaves confident cooks Mandy and Anny thinking there's more to youngsters Charlie and Lauren than meets the eye. At dinner, Rammy opens up about his troubled past. Colin has a rude awakening in the morning. At feedback time, Chris has a change of heart about some of his guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Colin Warburg and his student son Ben hope that their 81-room country pile - Scalford Hall Hotel in Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire - will wow their rivals. However, Chris and Rammy are still smarting from their feedback and think that Colin is playing games. After an afternoon crate stacking competition on the hotel's high wire course, Colin gets a grilling at dinner. A lukewarm reaction to breakfast only adds to Colin's woes and when he sees his feedback he suspects that retribution is at hand

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the Abbey Hotel in Battle, East Sussex, run by confident young colleagues Charlie Thompson and Lauren Tucker. However when Charlie and Lauren's guests arrive, Colin and Ben feel the squeeze and Chris and Rammy find themselves in a sticky situation. On an afternoon at the archery range, scores are settled. At dinner, straight-talking Chris can't help but be impressed, but when the conversation turns to parking, the guests are in a jam with their hosts. Later, Colin's feedback leaves Lauren wanting answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet up to settle some scores. Laskill Country House host Mandy wants to crack where she went wrong with breakfast and why Colin and Ben failed to connect with her, while Chris and Rammy from The Swan Hotel wish to question Lauren on her room flaws and get to the bottom of Colin's bedroom nightmares

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: A look back at the transformation of Dick Strawbridge and his wife Angel's 45-room chateau from an abandoned ruin into a sumptuous family home.
