Meanwhile, 86-year-old John is admitted to A&E with a suspected 'triple A' - a ruptured aortic aneurysm in his abdomen, a condition that can be fatal. The doctors must work quickly to diagnose the cause of the internal bleeding, but their investigations reveal further complications. programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are in Russia as the motoring magazine returns, taking part in a race across the urban landscape of St Petersburg. James defends the honour of the car in a very small Renault, Richard tries to prove that pedalling is faster by riding a bicycle, while Jeremy attempts to demonstrate that water is the quickest way across town by piloting a hovercraft. To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. Plus, the new Lamborghini Huracan is put through its paces and singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran takes to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo retraces railway journeys made by Queen Victoria in the south of England, where she would travel from Windsor Castle in Berkshire to her summer retreat on the Isle of Wight. The first leg of the trip takes him from Windsor's railway station to Didcot in Oxfordshire, stopping along the way to view a structure designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel in Maidenhead. He also tries to collect the mail in the manner of Victorian postal workers on a steam-powered travelling post office

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo has a go at playing Winchester Cathedral's Victorian organ as he continues his tour of Britain's railways. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

Progressing along the Long Island Railroad to Queens, Michael takes in an ambitious engineering project and a model town built by an Irish immigrant who became one of America's richest men. Nine years, several moves and a few job changes later, the pair are back in Kirkcaldy where Kirstie catches up with them. In 2020, Digi had a big budget and even bigger expectations. She was looking for a country pile near London with outbuildings for both her businesses that was close to daughter Emily's school and full of character. programme.desc: Architect George Clarke delves into the world of ingenious small builds, meeting people creating places to live, work and play in the most unlikely of places. Here he meets a couple who turned an old fire engine into a bar to raise money for firefighters' charities and a 23-year-old who built a shepherd's hut from scratch, including the nuts and bolts. George also visits an extraordinary home in Chile and Will Hardie builds a telescope

programme.title: Ancient Egypt by Train with Alice Roberts
programme.desc: Alice visits upper Egypt and completes her journey in the city of Aswan, whose quarries provided the granite for the country's ancient monuments. The towns along the railway line each have their very own Ancient Egyptian temple. Alice finishes up taking a boat to see the extraordinary Philae Temple that was rebuilt in the 1970s due to flooding caused by the Aswan dam

programme.title: Big Fat Quiz of the Year 2022
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the annual quiz, with Stephen Merchant, Katherine Ryan, Richard Ayoade, Maisie Adam, Jonathan Ross and Rose Matafeo being quizzed on the strange events of 2022. As ever, Charles Dance, Jon Snow and the children of Mitchell Brook Primary School are on hand to help Jimmy pose his questions

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Chris McCausland is joined by comedian and presenter Tom Allen in Rome, where they eat ice cream before it melts, zip around the city on a rickety Vespa, train to be gladiators, learn to sing opera and make pasta from scratch. And will Tom's one-of-a-kind commentary do the Colosseum justice for Chris?

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody: The Home County Cartel
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary focuses on the importation of huge quantities of Class A drugs, following the work of covert detectives from the Eastern Region Special Operation Unit. A consignment weighing more than 100kg has been intercepted while being imported into the UK from Europe. To reveal who is behind this, an undercover operation is authorised to closely monitor the shipment, using audio and visual equipment, as it travels to its final destination at a farm in rural Hertfordshire

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Members of the Fullagar family get more than they bargained for when they are introduced to father and daughter, Pepe and Tink - who can't be separated. Meanwhile, Louise and Angela are conflicted when Trinity a five-month-old lurcher puppy shows off both her adorable side and an impressive ability to chew everything from furniture to shoes

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow junior doctor Ming, who for the first time in his career carries out a needle aspiration on a 19-year-old patient brought into A&E with a collapsed lung. A woman who is 17 weeks pregnant falls down the stairs, and fears the accident may lead to a possible miscarriage. She recounts her struggles to conceive, and fears that if this pregnancy fails, she may never have a child

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Royle Farm in Staffordshire, where mother and son Margaret and Fraser Mountford hope their farmhouse with a difference will capture the guests' imaginations

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords

In Lewisham, the council's Rogue Landlord Unit raids one of their main streets, on the lookout for slum conditions, illegal overcrowding and criminal activities

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: After his tenants refuse to move out, a landlord starts building work around them, while another landlord tries to recover £30,000 in unpaid rent through the courts

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A man has to call in eviction specialists to remove tenants from the house he inherited from his grandparents. Music entrepreneur Donovan has not received rent from one of his tenants for seven months, so the case ends up in court

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A retired secretary has to visit her tenant in prison to retake possession of her buy-to-let flat. A Manchester mother applies to the housing charity Shelter for help because she is convinced the property she is renting is making her children ill

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: In North Yorkshire, more than a thousand drink-drivers are arrested every year meaning police are always looking out for suspicious cars and drivers taking their chances. Near Wetherby, a pursuit of a suspected drug driver reaches speeds of 130 mph before it ends with a head-on smash with a police car, while police receive reports that a driver has crashed his car down an embankment into a holiday home near Scarborough and fled the scene. Suspicions run high when a driver collides with a motorbike and then downs pints of beer in his local pub straight after the accident

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Yorkshire police forces tackling an ever-more sophisticated criminal fraternity from the cities to the Dales. Police from the north and west of the historic county crack down on drug-addled drivers, and it is North Yorkshire's Roads Policing Group that faces the toughest challenge when a convicted drug dealer leads officers on a 140mph chase on one of the UK's busiest motorways. Jamie Theakston narrates

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: The Night Stalker: Terror in a Small Town
programme.desc: In 1996, women began to disappear off the streets of Claremont, sending shockwaves through the wealthy suburb of Perth and all of Australia. A community lived in fear and the perpetrator simply disappeared, leaving behind a chilling trail of rape and murder. It took more than 20 years and the assistance of FBI profilers and British forensic experts to uncover the identity of the killer, who was someone already in the system. Through the lens of the surviving victims, this documentary reveals how society can enable a serial killer to hide in plain sight - and the devastating legacy of a series of terrifying disappearances

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A stage magician has kept the fact that he is a Nazi war criminal a secret for years. When a nightclub manager threatens to expose him, the illusionist kills him and arranges the perfect alibi - because at the time of the murder, he was apparently performing an escapology act. However, Columbo sets out to uncover the truth. Detective drama, with Peter Falk and Jack Cassidy

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A possessive painter who fears his ex-wife will expose his dark secrets resorts to killing her, but makes it appear she drowned. However, Columbo is unconvinced and draws on his broad palette of experience to reveal the truth. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Patrick Bauchau and Fionnula Flanagan

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A country singer arranges for his wife and his underage lover to both die in a phoney plane crash after his spouse diverts all his money to her religious causes in revenge for his affair. He is confident he remains above suspicion, but Columbo realises something does not add up and sets out to wrest a confession from the musician. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Johnny Cash and Ida Lupino

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: An American chess champion fears he is about to be beaten by a superior player from Russia, and decides the only sure-fire way he can avoid defeat is by murdering his opponent. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Laurence Harvey and Jack Kruschen

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The wife of a criminal who died in prison swears revenge on the men she holds responsible for his incarceration - including Columbo. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Helen Shaver and Ian McShane

programme.desc: Sloane is adamant that a man who held her hostage and tortured her years ago in Afghanistan and was believed to have been killed following her rescue, is alive and in DC, leading Vance and Gibbs to fear she is willing to risk everything to destroy him. Mark Harmon, Maria Bello and Rocky Carroll star

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy tries to trap a crooked lawyer who bribes his clients - but as he tries to track down the man's accomplice, he realises the investigation has placed his own job on the line. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An answering machine message leads Briscoe and Curtis to reopen an investigation into an arson attack that killed a girl - but the 15-year-old suspect has a powerful ally in his grandfather, an influential force in political spheres. Award-winning police drama, guest starring Robert Vaughn (Hustle) alongside Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of a Middle Eastern man sends Briscoe and Curtis racing to thwart a suspected terrorist plot to bring destruction to New York - and leads them to uncover a domestic conspiracy involving horrific female circumcision. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Paramedics become suspicious about a baby's death, calling in Briscoe and Curtis, who discover the parents adopted the child from an illegal Russian ring. The case takes on another dimension altogether when it transpires that the crooks specialise in placing terminally ill infants with unsuspecting families. Starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy and Carmichael have the unenviable task of prosecuting three police officers with a racially motivated hate crime that threatens to cause uproar in the city. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Angie Harmon

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A narcotics detective plans a major drugs sting but makes the mistake of illegally using a teenager as bait - with fatal consequences. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee reluctantly visits his high school after the unique computer password he used as a teenager is linked to the murder of a Department of Defense contractor. The case escalates when an intruder breaks into McGee's home in an attempt to steal his archaic high school computer

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates a man overboard fatality from a Navy destroyer at sea. Torres is frustrated with Vance's assignment to mentor three high school students. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Wilmer Valderrama

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Jimmy is torn between family and work after father-in-law Ed asks him to tamper with evidence from NCIS' current murder investigation. Ed Slater's poker friend, Anthony DiNozzo Sr, offers to help with the case. Brian Dietzen, Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Robert Wagner star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An arms dealer's release from prison leads to a fresh wave of violence, leaving Torres to face the repercussions of his actions during an undercover operation years earlier

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins and Benson investigate the rape of an underage girl, who initially refuses to co-operate or press charges against a trio of suspects, but eventually comes clean and leads the detectives to the strip club where she works - although her boss denies any wrongdoing and rejects a request for his client list. Starring Mariska Hargitay and Kelli Giddish

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team responds to the reported kidnapping of a 16-year-old girl at a party - and her disappearance could be linked with her boyfriend's gang associations. Elsewhere, Benson has a ceremony to decree her becoming the new SVU sergeant. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators discover probationary agent Ned Dorneget has been bugged by Harper Dearing, the man behind a spate of arson attacks on US Navy vessels. A phone call from the man himself makes it clear he is out for revenge, and Sam Ryan has information as to the motive behind it. Guest starring Richard Schiff (The West Wing)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to track down wanted terrorist Harper Dearing before another US Navy ship is destroyed, and a desperate Gibbs enlists the aid of a prisoner to draw his target out of hiding. Meanwhile, Palmer is forced to consider putting his nuptials on hold as the stand-off with Dearing becomes heated. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny tries to juggle work and his love life as he spends a romantic weekend with Linda while keeping one eye on an investigation. Elsewhere, Jamie's undercover mission draws him deeper into the world of the villainous Cavazerre family. Police drama, starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Jamie and Renzulli respond to an emergency call at a church, but are forcibly prevented from entering the building by its security team. The officers then sustain injuries as the confrontation turns violent, and Frank's diplomatic skills are put to the test as he tries to handle the aftermath of the incident

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Torres relies on his team's investigative skills after he awakens on a dilapidated fishing boat shirtless, disoriented and nursing a pounding headache. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

Nichols and Stevens find that there have been three similar cases during the previous four years and that the people involved were part of a warped psychological study. Guest starring Dallas Roberts (The Walking Dead, Rubicon)

programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert visits the Weald on the Kent-Sussex border, where he observes herds of fallow deer with fawns in the medieval royal hunting park of Ashdown Forest, and joins ranger Alice Parfitt to explore the sights the heathland has to offer. Landscape archaeologist Nicola Bannister helps him understand the role of the iron industry in shaping the area

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert recalls some of his favourite moments from the programme. Beginning the series on the Isle of Mull, he swam with the world's second-largest fish, the basking shark, and observed white-tailed eagle chicks in their nest. He then explored the Yorkshire Dales and Salisbury Plain, took a trip down the River Wye and studied the wildlife of Scotland's west coast. There were also visits to the Weald, and the Isle of Wight, where Ray had the perfect opportunity to film red squirrels and badgers

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton continues his island-hopping odyssey, exploring the islands scattered in the Firth of Forth. He discovers these seemingly peaceful islands have a dramatic history of warfare, from medieval English raids on Inchcolm to the first air-raid attack on Britain above Inchgarvie. Paul learns about the strategic importance of Inchkeith's defences during two world wars before heading to the Bass Rock to learn more about the history of prisoners incarcerated on the island, with 160,000 gannets for company

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: For his final tour, Paul Murton goes over the sea to Skye, where he visits the home of writer and naturalist Gavin Maxwell, before scaling the famous Cuillin mountain, Am Basteir. On the nearby Isle of Raasay he learns the amazing true story of the crofter Calum Macleod, who between 1964 and 1974 singlehandedly built a road to connect his isolated community

programme.title: The Flying Scotsman
programme.desc: During its lifetime, the Flying Scotsman has broken records, travelled the world, starred in a movie and even bankrupted its owners. Engineer Rob Bell presents the first of a two-part documentary charting the history of the world's most famous steam locomotive, looking at why has it inspired such affection among steam fans and still attracts huge crowds wherever it goes

programme.title: The Smallest Show on Earth (1957)
programme.desc: A newly married couple inherit a dilapidated cinema and its incompetent staff and resolve to transform its fortunes. They soon find, however, that their hopes for the future are far more difficult to realise than anticipated. Basil Dearden's comedy, starring Bill Travers, Virginia McKenna, Peter Sellers, Margaret Rutherford, Bernard Miles and Leslie Phillips

programme.title: The Devil's Disciple (1959)
programme.desc: The black sheep of a family is befriended by a minister. A case of mistaken identity leads both men to discover their true vocations during the American War of Independence. Historical drama based on George Bernard Shaw's play, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas and Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The Vicious Circle (1957)
programme.desc: A surgeon is horrified to find an actress has been murdered in his home, and calls the police. However, they soon discover the murder weapon in his car, leaving the finger of suspicion pointing straight at him. A desperate race against time ensues, as the medic tries to clear his name and find the real killer. Thriller, starring John Mills, Lisa Daniely, Derek Farr, Roland Culver and Noelle Middleton

programme.title: Castle Builders
programme.desc: How castles fared under attack, featuring the story of Bad King John and one of the bloodiest sieges in English history

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The Alphans visit a bizarre planet where the past and the future are apparently interchangeable. Starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: Biggles: Adventure In Time (1986)
programme.desc: A New York businessman is mysteriously transported back in time to the First World War, where he meets the famed British flying ace Biggles. The time traveller discovers he has been sent back to help the daredevil pilot destroy a German secret weapon that could change the course of history. Sci-fi adventure, starring Neil Dickson, Alex Hyde-White and Peter Cushing in his final film role

programme.title: Winter of Our Dreams (1981)
programme.desc: Prostitute Lou encounters her dead friend's ex, who wants to discover why she committed suicide. A relationship develops between them, but when Lou acquires her friend's diary, she realises to her horror that she is repeating the mistakes of the past. Drama, with Judy Davis and Bryan Brown

programme.title: Too Late (2015)
programme.desc: A private eye is hired to track down a missing woman with a connection to his own troubled past. The search leads him on a journey through the seedy underworld of Los Angeles, and into a series of encounters with lost souls and eccentric personalities. Detective drama, starring John Hawkes and Jeff Fahey

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The events of Febtuary 25, 2009, when Turkish Airlines Flight 1951 went down less than a mile from the runway at Amsterdam Schiphol Airport, breaking into three pieces on impact and killing nine passengers and crew and all three pilots. A faulty radio altimeter was the initial catalyst in a chain of errors that led to the horrific crash. Here, survivors tell their story of escaping from the wreckage of what should have been a normal commute home to Amsterdam

programme.desc: The day of Kate's Oxford interview dawns, but Mary's support is short-lived when she has to rush back to London to help a teenage mother hiding an important secret. William is put under pressure by Billy Two Hats to commit to the band and later faces a difficult situation at work when he has to consider the possibility his client was the victim of a mercy killing. Brendan gives Reuben a frosty reception when he turns up unannounced and Molly begins her treatment. Romantic drama, starring Peta Cornish, Julie Graham, Martin Clunes, Ricci Mcleod and Paterson Joseph

programme.title: Everything Must Go (2010)
programme.desc: A man's heavy drinking costs him his job and leads to his wife kicking him out of the house. He sets up home on their lawn, amid all the possessions she has thrown out, and to avoid seeming homeless, he begins selling them, leading him to make new friendships with his neighbours and gradually straighten out his life. Comedy drama, starring Will Ferrell and Laura Dern

programme.title: Kill Ben Lyk (2018)
programme.desc: When three people with the same name are murdered in London in 24 hours, Scotland Yard attempts to gather all the other Ben Lyks located in the city until they can figure out who's after them and why. Director Erwan Marinopoulos's comedy thriller, starring Martyn Ford, Eugene Simon and Bronson Webb

programme.title: Detachment (2011)

Drama, starring Adrien Brody, Marcia Gay Harden and James Caan
